text: Awesome service, and incredible food! We were at Alex's table and he was a great server. I was really impressed because most high end places take all night bring food thinking you want to be there the whole evening. They did a wonderful job keeping our pace moving through glasses of wine, apps, lobster bisque,  the main course and we were in and out in an hour and a half and had a tremendous experience. Will be back!

Excellent food and service. Waitress was very helpful when asked for suggestions. But definitely a once on special occasion place because of pricing. Will definitely be back for next special occasion.

We had an early dinner here last night before the game with my two boys and their buddy. After making reservations I read some reviews, I picked a few excellent and then read the 2 poor and 3 terrible to get an idea of what could go wrong. Usually it's either a simple mistake or a staff looked at someone which they perceived wrong and they cop the "I'm the big paying customer attitude" when in fact the staff probably was clueless to the perceptions and still has no idea unless they read the review! I found this to be the case with these, don't get me wrong, service is important but if you start your review off with "The food was well-prepared and tasted good", there could possibly be a problem in the mirror! We had two cowboy ribeyes, a filet and sea bass. All plates were well prepared, good looking, and great taste. One of the first things you notice is that there are no salt or pepper shakers on the tables. This can be interpreted two ways; you choose. I strayed a bit from my usual French onion soup and got the butternut squash soup with cream and pumpkin seed. It was delicious but a little too sweet for my taste so my 16 year old finished it off. I ordered a house salad to get some acidity to counter act the sweet and it worked out well. Steaks came perfectly cooked, and looked amazing. My wife and I recently went to Flemings and the ribeye they served didn't look half as good as this one. Matter of fact the bone in at Texas Land and Cattle looks better than the Flemings steak. My son's friend also had the cowboy ribeye and his too looked amazing. It just makes for a better meal when your first impression is "wow; that looks good". The other dishes were well plated also. We accompanied the entrees with creamed spinach and steakhouse prepared mushrooms, both well prepared with sharp flavors.  Service, where most people had their problems, wasn't ours at all. The service couldn't have been better. Our waitress was kind, professional, and presented herself and Sullivan's with class. She wasn't overly attentive and didn't disappear for long periods, just right. Kudos to Katelin, we appreciate her professionalism and kindness in her service. She alone pushes the final rating to excellent. Go to Sullivan's and enjoy a great meal

I have not yet experienced Sullivan's steaks, but have recently been to a Thursday night drink and entertainment night at their bar and patio. I was disappointed in their mixed drinks, bad enough that I switched to wine shortly thereafter; the entertainment was great though! Nice mix of patrons there as well. I will go again in hopes that it was just an "off" night for the bartenders.

Great place to eat! I love that it is located right out of the city so I don't have to mess with parking uptown. My favorite thing to do is come on a Thursday night for $6 bar food and drinks and then take the lightrail to the Common Market in South End or all the way into town for shows and games.  You can also host private events here! They make it really easy to do. Highly recommended!

My go to place in Charlotte. I think it is the best steak in town. The lounge area is well done and the bar menu is fantastic if you're not in the mood for a massive meal. Always a pleasant crowd and the service is excellent.

Took my BF for a steak dinner here.  The prices were reasonable for an upper-scale steakhouse, and the place appears to be known for its martinis, which we love, so off we went.  The steaks were great!  I got the filet, and the BF got the NY strip.  I think we both agreed that my steak was tastier, since it was so tender. I agree with the previous reviewer that they put a lot of pepper on the steaks, but I really thought it added to the flavor.  He got horseradish mashed potatoes on the side, which I thought were delicious.  I got a baked potato, which they dress for you table-side.  All the steaks are served with a wedge salad with blue cheese.  It was very tasty, although I thought it would be better with bacon -- perhaps you should ask for that on the side, if you go.  After dinner, we had Irish coffees.  Not on the dessert menu, but they were happy to oblige.  So, bottom line, how do I feel about this place?  OK, so a couple of things that I wasn't too jazzed about, and I felt like this impacted my general opinion about the restaurant service:  1) Our waitress was very nice, but scarce.  Wouldn't have been that big of a deal, except for....  2) My potato was not hot.  I know, I know, I'm being high-maintenance, right? But I don't think so.  I've decided to come here, pay for a $35 steak.  The least you can do is bring me a potato that's not ROOM TEMPERATURE.  Seriously.  I want to eat my $7 baked potato with the rest of my meal.  I had to wait a while before I could track her down.  Overall, the meal was good.  The ambiance is nice.  Steak is good.  I'd recommend going here -- just don't order the baked potato!

My husband and I celebrated our 30th wedding anniversary there last Saturday.  The food was spectacular and the service was second to none.  Our server Luke was the absolute best!  Can't wait to return.

So I'm having a steakhouse conversation with some friends and Sullivan's comes up...I know it's a chain, and I know there are more popular places in town, but if you have been here multile times, the overall consistency of the experience at Sullivan's stands out in my mind! I can't say that I've ever had a bad meal or service experience here. Of the upscale steakhouses (Del Frisco's, Beef and Bottle, Morton's, Ruth's Chris, Palm, etc), Sullivan's may not rate as the best in each category (food, service, value, atmosphere), but I would put it 2 or 3 in each one - thus giving it the title of Charlotte's best steakhouse.

Amazing all around dining experience. Staff was knowledgable about the food and very friendly. Best steak I have had in a long time, plus Mac & cheese with lobster side was outstanding. I will definitely return!
decent, had to check it out as I have heard great things on Sully's from neighbors.   serve and food wad middle of the road.

This is absolutely my favorite restaurant. The food is consistently excellent, the service is commendable, and my husband and I are always made to feel like we are special. Great place to take the family. Mike, the new manager, is phenomenal--greeted as we came in and left. Always try to insure that everything was 100% satisfactory. Our rating for this restaurant A+!

My husband and I went there for dinner. It was recommended by the hotel. I personally don't like the fact hat you have to purchase everything separately. I expected he food to be much better than it was for the prices. Staff was not very friendly.  Expect more from a place that is suppose to be high end
You want a great steak, a good bottle of wine and a nice place to enjoy it with experienced, knowledgeable staff?  Go to Sullivan's.  End of story.

Went to Sullivan's on Valentine's Day and was very disappointed.  Our reservations were 8:15pm.  We arrived at 8:00 to find the line for valet was wrapped around the block.  It seems to me that if you are aware it will be a busy time the valet situation would be better planned out.  There was a pre-fixed menu for the evening was fine but for $89 per person the steak should be tasty.  My date ordered his steak medium well and it was so tough he was unable to cut it.  My creamed spinach was cold and my date's mashed potatoes were very stiff.  There was a lady going from table to table taking pictures, however she never stopped by to ask us if we wanted a photo.  Yes I am African American and I never use the race card but it was very strange that she never came to our table.  I've been to Sullivan's before but this will be my final visit.

Just returned from an anniversary celebration dinner at Sullivan's. My wife and I had dined at Sullivan's before and it was actually quite good.  However, on this visit, my steak was not cooked properly.  I ordered a long bone dry aged ribeye, medium rare.  The steak was cooked medium at best and I would argue the beef was NOT dry aged.  I've ordered dry aged beef from Sullivan's in the past and it was a beautiful, ruby red color.  On this visit, my steak  was anemic.  I sent it back and received a properly cooked yet still anemic piece of meat.  It's protocol for fine steakhouses to ask customers to cut into their steaks to check that they are cooked to their liking.  This was not done at Sullivan's. I also noticed that the $59 "dry aged" ribeye I ordered became a $61 steak on the final bill.  Yes, it's only $2 but I wonder if that was a surcharge for me sending back my original steak. Quite disappointed.  Service was sub par. We were never brought plates for our appetizers.  We were also promised by our server that we would be getting complimentary champagne at the end of our meal for our anniversary.  This never happened. I had to flag down another server because ours had disappeared.  For this price point, I expect perfection in quality of beef, execution and service.  Sullivan's can learn so much from Del Frisco's. Sullivan's is lacking in attention to details.  I recommend you spend your hard earned money elsewhere.

I couldn't recommend Sullivan's more highly.   The food is exceptional, but at around $100/person that's expected. What wasn't expected was the service. I've never been treated so well at any restaurant. Our server Ashley was phenomenal.   I'm a bonafide cheapskate, and after spending $200 on a meal walked away feeling like it was a bargain.

I've been to fine establishments but this was nothing special and WAY OVERPRICED.  They nickel and dime you for everything.  For the Bearnaise sauce on the steak ....$3 ..... a diet coke .......$3.50 and so on and so forth.    The steak was good but nothing that I couldn't get somewhere else for less.  We didn't get out of there for less than $130 and that is just plain ridiculous!  That left a bad taste in my mouth.  Yes, I knew to expect pricey but it wasn't that worthy.  I will choose other places in the future.

Was seated as soon as we got here and service was excellent as not a glass remained empty the entire time we where here. Food was excellent, fresh and hot and all was cooked the way I like it. Another plus was the fresh and strong coffee.
Great food and great ambiance! Staff is knowledgeable of their menu options and on queue. Food is delicious and fresh- highly recommend this Steak and Seafood establishment!

The first time I visited this location I was throughly pleased with the service and the quality of the meal. I decided to take a few friends with me this time and I was quite disappointed. I had the 12oz Filet Mignon, prepared medium rare, closer to the rare side. When it arrived I was upset when I cut into a medium cooked piece of meat. I brought it to our waitresses attention (who was very pleasant throughout our visit) and she took it back to be corrected right away. The weight wasn't long before the manager arrived with a new cut that was suppose to be prepared correctly this go around. Once again I was disappointed when I cut into another improperly prepared steak. I was too frustrated at the time to address it again, plus my company was already half way through their own meals. I enjoyed all other aspects of my meal except the steak and cheesecake. It's unfortunate that such a high quality restaurant can be so inconsistent with its food. Will give them one last shot, a best two out of three hopefully.

I eat here often and they have never disappointed.  Being from NYC, I'm a big fan of fine steak restaurants and Sullivan's has everything I want when good beef is called for.  The service is always great and they make me feel like a local.

Sullivans has won me back. We went for Christmas Eve.  The only problem was the reservation wasn't in the system but they got us in.  We got the Seafood Tower.  I had looked forward to the tower all week. I wasn't disappointed.  Crab, lobster tails, Shrimp Cocktails, and oyster were all fresh and delicious.  We had an excellent bottle of Viognier .  We all ate bacon wrapped scallops.  Yes, we ate seafood at a steak resturant because the get in fresh seafood several times a week.  We had the best service that we have ever had at Sullivan's.  I wish I could remember his name but he was originally from Ecuador.  He was attentive and gracious but not in our face.  It was a fabulous celebration for Christmas Eve.

This is my second review of Sullivan's. Last night we walked over to use a gift card issued us after our last unfortunate visit, Christmas Eve 2011.  We were going to what was to be a 'party' with drink specials and bar bites. Mostly what we found was 1/2 glass or inconsistent wine pours and no bar bites. We ordered a flatbread off the bar menu that came out cold and uncooked. As it turned out, the manager returned our gift card because it took so long for our food to come out.   The people sitting next to us at the bar had a 7:30 reservation for the dining room. When they arrived, they were told to wait in the bar, that it would be 8:00. It had to be closer to 8:30 before they were seated.  We walked to a local favorite and had dinner as we left hungry. Why is this local landmark so disappointing. We meet a friend at Sullivan's every Christmas Eve for dinner, it's a tradition. This year we will meet somewhere else.

Great service! They were very nice! My steak wasn't fully cooked how I asked and without me even saying anything a lady who might have been the manager walked over and asked me about my steak and if it's the color I wanted. I was honest but very nice about it saying i'll heat it up and have it for lunch the next day. She insisted on bringing me a new one. I declined. Ten minutes later she comes out with a whole new steak and sides and offers to box up mine for me. She assured me how she wants me to be fully happy and satisfied right then and there. Such exceptional customer service, It was also my anniversary and my waiter brought out free dessert which was so sweet and thoughtful. Love this place and I'm a regular especially for happy hour and take out!

Sullivan's has always been on my list for "must go to" restaurants/steak houses; they certainly didn't disappoint. its located in the South End of Charlotte and offer complimentary valet but honestly if the weather isn't bad, save yourself the wait and tight space and just park a block over, adjacent from the restaurant and simply walk over.  I took advantage of Queens Feast/ restaurant week. They were behind on reservations (the only reason why they didn't get 5 stars) I think we were seated maybe 15-20mins after our scheduled reservation.  for a starter the lovely waitress recommended the seafood sampler... which by the way was bonkers (Crab legs & claws/ Colossal shrimp/ Fresh oysters/ Lobster tails). its fairly pricey though ($60 smh)  The first course consisted of the Shrimp & Lobster bisque which was good. nothing mind blowing. For the main entrée however, I go the 8oz. Hand-Cut Filet Mignon with  horseradish mashed potatoes and asparagus. I can honestly say that was one of the most delectable steaks I've ever had; it was cooked EXACTLY how I asked for it (medium) and you could literally cut it with a butter knife (I know because I tried and succeeded with little to no effort). I also added the signature Cajun butter on my steak with even more so enhanced the flavor that was already there. for dessert was both the New York Style Cheesecake (amazing w/ fresh strawberries) and the best Bananas Foster Bread Pudding I've ever had with Vanilla Ice Cream and Caramel sauce on the side. My date was literally trying to stab me with her fork because I kept attempting to steal a bite LOL.

Went into the bar and had to wait till a manager came around to get a beer. A beer later I had to ask a busboy for the check. No idea if the food is good, the bartender was terrible and if he doesn't wait on you, you have to go somewhere else! I went across the street to Luciano's and had a great experience!
The best and most elegant of all the pricy steakhouses. Definitely worth a try for Restaurant Week.
I have only been to this restaurant for the happy hour. It's wonderful! Flavorful, strong drinks and very flavorful food. The live jazz and dim lighting make for a great ambiance.
Pricey. Its a fancy atmosphere with not-so-great food and service. I expected more for my money.

We went for the first time to celebrate our 2 birthdays.   From the friendly greeting to the amazing server (Austin) to the 2 managers who checked in on us (and brought us roses for our birthdays),  it was just a stellar experience from start to finish.  This was our first time here and I would recommend to anyone looking for top notch service and amazing food.  Lots to recommend from the knockout drink to the ribeye and filet to the creme brûlée.  Thanks to Sullivan's for making this a special night!  We'll definitely be back.
Service is slow. Food is slow. Everything was served cold and they needed more help. I don't get it. And apparently other people don't either. It's a Friday night at 7:30 and the place is dead.

I haven't been there in a while  but this place was my fave. I wish they open one in all corners of Charlotte. It's a steak house with a few feathered in fine choices of seafood,  love the oyster and .y fave of all ahi tuna sashimi grade. Yummy

I contacted Sullivan's ahead of time to let them know I would be proposing.  They went out of their way to save us a choice table!  The manager came out to personally congratulate and give us free champaign and dessert.  Now to the food review.  WOW!  The filet was incredibly tender, juicy, and delicious.  They did a magnificent job of giving the filet just enough seasoning to still allow the flavor of the steak itself to shine through.  The sides and dessert were to die for.  We loved the atmosphere and decor!  What a romantic place to go for an excellent dinner.  Don't forget to leave the kids at home ;)

I've read a few of the reviews and I must say, any rating below 4 stars is insane.  My experience at this restaurant was nothing less than outstanding.  My wife brought me here as an early birthday celebration, and the atmosphere was very cool. They had a small talented band that provided background music which added to ambiance of the place.  The service was great from the time that we entered the door until we left. The waitress that we had was very nice, always communicated with us in regards to receiving our order, and she was incredibly helpful. Now as far as the food goes, simply amazing.  The Shrimp and lobster bisque is just sooooooo good along with the ahi tuna with the cucumber and ginger.  And ofcourse this being a steakhouse the steaks have to be on point. I had the New York strips and I must say that the steak juicy, tender, and full of flavor. My one and only complaint is the fact there was this group that was extremely loud but the fact the tables were close didn't really affect my dinning experience.  All and all, this is a great restaurant and I would recommend this to friends.

Well after many attempts to try this well known establishment we finally made it. Not to shabby but do have some complaints. At first, service was impeccable. But then, we were left for long periods of time and I had to go without coffee a couple of times and had to resort to the ice water to wash my food down messing up the flavor ratio that I was enjoying with the coffee. Anywho, we went during restaurant week and did order from that menu. We both had the same thing which was the iceberg lettuce wedge with the homemade blue cheese dressing for what was considered the first course and then the 8 oz filet with the horseradish mashed potatoes and sautéed  green beans for the second course and finally the bananas foster bread pudding with caramel sauce and vanilla bean ice cream. The wedge was o.k. as the homemade blue cheese dressing wasn't any better than what I could make at home. Hence "Homemade" I assume. The filets we order well-done and have had disastrous results at other places but there have been a few that actually know how to cook a well-done steak and not let it become dry and disgusting. This wasn't one of those places, or at least not when we went. We found that the cook had gashed opened our filets to see if they were in fact well-done and anyone who knows anything about cooking steak will agree that the last thing one should do is cut into a freshly cooked steak as it will lose most of the juices. This is exactly what occurred here. What a shame too. The sautéed green beans where very crunchy and could have stayed in the pan a bit longer. The mashed potatoes were more than likely the best thing about the whole meal. I really cannot think of a thing wrong with them other than there could have been more of them. They were very good. And last but not least, The bread pudding. I wouldn't order this again as it came out room temp. and the first bite had me at "a little stale". It could, and should, have been much better. Especially for the type of place this is supposed to be. What time the waitress did spend with us, she was warm and welcoming plus very helpful in answering all our questions. We will have to come and give them another chance after all the fuss and muss of this restaurant week passes. Maybe when it is a time that they are not offering specials so we can see if there is a difference in the regular menu food and service as opposed to the price you pay for the specials. Is it one of those times when you get what you pay for?

At first I was excited to see a local volunteer group scheduled our social for this location.  I left hungry and annoyed.  The good: nice bar area, they had a great duo or trio playing a stand up bass and nice music.   The bad: we ordered from the bar menu, which had good prices and seemed like a good idea.  It was not.  I ordered the "best burger in Charlotte" which turned out to be a seriously salty, dry, hard burger.  I ate a few bites thinking it might get better.  It didn't.  The home-made chips were not salty at all, cold, and tasted like they were cooked in old oil.  Not pleasant.  My friend ordered a "steak" dish which looked completely unappetizing and she said was just about all gristle.    I won't go back and would not recommend this restaurant.

We went during restaurant week. It annoys me when restaurants use that as an excuse, but I think it's a fair disclosure in a review.  Food was worth at least 4.5 stars -- maybe 5. Our waitress was wonderful; she provided practical advice regarding food selections, even as we tried to figure out how to navigate the menu given the option of the restaurant week prix-fixe choices. We each had the kale salad, which had wonderful ingredients, though the creamy dressing took away from the natural tastes of the kale, pecans, and dried berries. I had a 12-ounce filet, which was quite well-prepared. I like steak cooked medium-well, which earns glares from foodies and so I often get a lower-quality barrel-cut filets (as I did on this night), but it was cooked perfectly and I didn't notice the extra fat or toughness that this cut sometimes has. My wife had the 6 oz filet from the prix-fixe menu. Horseradish mashed potatoes on her plate had a "seafood restaurant" kind of flavor, but she ate some of my baked potato, which was enormous and yet perfectly cooked, which is often hard with the largest potatoes.  Two stars because the front-of-house management was not good and left a bad taste in our mouths for the night overall. Valet service was required, though there was ample parking right in front of the restaurant (that had been blocked off for the valet service). That wouldn't have been awful (it is free) except that when we exited, there were seven or eight cars backed up waiting to be parked and one harried valet attendant running to and fro. He paid no attention to us or the four other groups waiting for their cars, so I went over and told him to give me my key and tell me where my car was. That worked out nicely, actually, because my car was pretty close. If you're not going to let me park my car, though, you'd better have the valet process down cold.  The hostess and seating attendant were young girls who seemed to think it was their job to protect the restaurant from people they deemed insufficiently cool. I didn't feel welcomed, and they were not prepared to seat us at our reservation time (they didn't apologize, but said, "you can wait in that corner" and pointed to the three square foot area next to the walkway to the bar. When the seating attendant took us to our table, she started clanking around the extra glasses and silverware (the table had been set for 4 rather than 2), though she left them all cluttered up there anyway, and didn't give us enough menus.   The restaurant is too crowded -- tables are squeezed together to maximize revenue, I suppose -- and was quite loud: so much so that my wife and I had trouble understanding each other across a corner booth table (we're in our thirties -- not hard of hearing or anything).  Quite good food, but Sullivan's is a "special event" kind of restaurant, and there are places in town that create a special night out kind of experience, so I wouldn't go back to Sullivan's.

Today was my birthday. We had a quiet table at the end of the lunch shift. Our server, Shelly S, was especially attentive and upbeat. The steak salad I ordered was perfect; my husband thought his Cobb salad was the best he has tasted. Sullivan's is a special occasion restaurant - Shelley even took a photograph for remembrance of the day. She brought the framed photo to our table, inscribed with her words "sending love and light your way." How special is that?  Yes, incredible personalized service. We highly recommend Sullivan's Steakhouse in Charlotte, North Carolina.

Dined here with my daughter during a weekend visit to NC.  Loved our experience.  The food was great, absolutely great drinks, with a lovely interior, small but very nice atmosphere.  Service was excellent. Also noticed the nice bar area, with a lounge and live music.  Will definitely return to dine next time in Charlotte.  Definitely worth a visit.

I went to Sullivan's Steakhouse during restaurant week in Charlotte. I have to say the really do give you your $30 worth of food, unlike some other steak houses with the similar promotion.  I had the Cesar salad which was just what a Cesar salad should be. For the main course of coarse I had the fillet, that was cooked to perfection, dessert was the banana's foster bread pudding (worth going back for just that),  Our Waitress was wonderful. All the girls ordered a glass of wine and they were out of two of the options. The waitress came back with similar wines and charged the same price for the glasses. She also told them if they wanted something different to ask. This was a great move on her part, no one was without a drink the whole meal!  Overall great place, not sure about the regular prices, but $30 was perfect for me!

I took three family members to Sullivans for a celebratory meal on friday evening. The dining room was so loud that we could not converse.The salad was tastless and the steak highly salted. But the biggest disappointment was no jazz music as advertised. I even phoned four hours  prior to verify the music.This was important to me as one of my guest's is a jazz muscian of some reputation.I will mot return to Sullivan's and now will be going to Captial Grill as before.

Sullivan's lives up to it's name here, for the most part. The seared ahi appetizer was very flavorful, just the right amount of spice. The meat consistency was a little off, but the abundance of flavor made up for this minor detail. The deviled eggs, while as good as a deviled egg can be, I'd not worth the $9 for four halves. French onion soup is exquisite, and the wedge salad is perhaps the best I've ever had. The bleu cheese dressing is absolutely spot on and plentiful.  Peppered strip streak, medium-rare, cooked perfectly and tastes very good. The filet, also some to perfection, was hit or miss. One tasted so-so all the way through, the other had the gristle still attached and was half decent, the other half very good. All sides very good, mac n cheese, mashed potatoes, potatoes au gratin, shrimp cocktails. Desserts tried, key lime pie, apple crumble, and cheesecake were all excellent. However, the key lime did have mixed reviews. All in all, service was impeccable, the atmosphere is just a little loud (however the place was packed), meats overall very good, and will return if in the area again. The Kansas City Sullivan's is better steak-wise; however, the 5-star is still earned here.

So I have to say having eaten at every good steak restaurant in Charlotte, this is my least favorite.  Let me start by saying I came during restaurant week, but to me that's the time when a restaurant shines impress me when you are slammed and I will definitely come back.  That said I am not impressed, first of all my ceaser salad had chewy croutons, not exactly sure how you go wrong with a crouton.  Secondly my steak was very mediocre, and honestly I could have had similar at Texas road house etc, honestly if i was paying full price I would probably be a lot more annoyed.   Sorry Sullivans but you could learn a lot from your sister restaurant Del Frisco, which not only remains my favorite but also is one of the best places for restaurant week.

Went for lunch with coworkers. Not the best experience. A little pushy with their service and food. Needed many water refills because they just kept adding more ice to my cup than water. Ordered the fish tacos and immediately after the first bite my stomach was rumbling. Coworker also felt that their salad was overdressed and did look too heavy. Another coworker complained about the steak not being cooked right. I did not try the desert because my stomach was still not happy with my entree so I couldn't tell you how the desert tasted. The table was not an even surface, but of course was draped nicely in white cloth to cover, so I had to constantly adjust my glass on the table so it wouldn't spill. The chairs were too heavy and took up too much space. Music in bathroom was too loud. Location is inconvenient to pull out from.  Overpriced and overrated. I will not return and will not recommend.

Unimpressed. Met a friend for drinks and ate from the bar menu. She said her burger was super salty and the homemade chips were stale. My tavern steak was a lot of gristle, although the sauce and sautéed spinach and mushrooms were good. The prices were good ($6 for each), but if you're using low quality or leftover ingredients, what's the point?

Always our old standby for date night. Service is always the best. We have gone to Sullivan's for every anniversary for the past 10 years plus birthdays. Glad to have a fabulous restaurant in the neighood.

Terrible meal- ordered my steak medium, and it came out like a charcoal pellet. Not only was it well done, it was cooked well beyond well done (inexcusable for a steak restaurant). They had turned a 40+ dollar filet into the texture and toughness of shoe leather. The other guest ordered a ribeye, and her steak quality was subpar. If you are going to spend this much money on a steak dinner, go to Capital Grille. Will never return.
Upscale steakhouse restaurant with great food and ambiance... Try the she crab soul and great lunch specials...One my favorite date night or special occasion place...

Excellent, classic steakhouse.  I had the privilage of going while my boyfriend's boss was picking up the tab, so that was a huge plus for me.  The food was great!  I had a mushroom duxelle filet with creamed spinach and white cheddar au gratin potatoes.  My steak was cooked perfectly and it had a goat cheese butter melted over the top that was to die for.  The steak really was delicious, but that sauce could have been served over an old sneaker and made it taste good.  The side dish portions are HUGE and definitely shar-able.  The table had oysters rockefeller, crab cakes, and calamari for appetizers and there was plenty to go around for all of us (table of 9).  The calamari are some of the best I have ever eaten.  They are gigantic, not rubbery at all, and have that fresh seafood melt-in-your-mouth quality.  The piece de resistance for me, however, was their signature Knockout martini.  They infuse chunks of pineapple in orange vodka for over a week and then crush it up, put it over ice, and strain the concoction into a martini glass.  Yowza....it is awesome!  Definitely pricey, but well worth it.  Good, solid food and our service was top-notch.

Another wonderful meal from Sullivan's! The Knockout Martini is a great starter and the Filet is cooked well and with great flavor. Ryan did a great job behind the bar. This remains one of my favorite steakhouses and it does not disappoint.

We went there for our anniversary a few weeks ago. The service is prompt but he didn't know what kind of steak they were serving us, had to ask the chef. He came back with a general response, it's prime meat...uh..okay!!! The food was decent but it wasn't the fancy experience we were hoping for. Overall, an okay experience.

Anniversary Dinner was great. Amber greeted us with a smile and was very friendly even saying happy anniversary.  Bob was assigned to our table and he was great.  All his food suggestions were great. Crabcake appetizer was amazing.  Trout stuffed with crab meat ummm ummm good.  Will definitely be back
Yay! I'm a fan. Great salmon! Nice atmosphere. Wouldn't recommend this place for a lunch destination. A little on the slow side.

Best steak and martinis in Charlotte! Our favorite place to eat. Filet trio is my go to. It's not on the menu but it is one of their specials frequently, if it isn't they will make it for you. My husband always gets the bone in filet, and it is phenomenal!

I just went out with a friend to this place last week.  I did read some comments from Yelpers as it's my first time.  Firstly, I was disappointed with the parking there.  Suit... I almost left as I drove round the whole parking building three times with no spot.  Ending up I had to use their valet.  Perhaps, this is to create jobs,  Tell our forecoming President.  I may be picky (you may say)  I'm half Jewish and I only do not eat pork or shell fish, besides due to my job, I see lobster and good food everyday, I did not have many choices of appetizer.  I picked steak tartar whatever but I did not like the taste as there was only meat taste.  I saw my friend order oyster that looked good.  We shared a porter house steak but he did not order any side.  (He was to pay and this was the first time eating out with him, I was observing.)  The meat was cooked to our choice - good.  For the others, wait till I go out with another friend and try again.  I see that the menu does have good items.  Good try.  The price???  Mummmm depending with where you want to compare. Feel like eating at Sheraton or Marriott Hotel.   It is pricey.  In California, you can get better price for this standard. But definitely, a place that you can show off a little bit if you are dating someone.  Haha!!  Overall, a place of class except the parking.  BTW, someone say casual dress, fortunately I always dress proper to any dinner.  Otherwise, I will be very embarrassed.  Perhaps the night I went there had lots of either company party or business people.  Sorry, am I too sarcastic???
Best restaurant in Charlotte!  Bar area was packed and fun with a lot of energy... it's a place to go at least once a week!

My experience was a 1 star! My friend had Tuna and loved it. That was the saving grace for the 2 stars.  The ambiance was nice. They had comfortable booths and nice art.  It was too loud for a nice conversation. Our waitress was very sweet and accommodating.  Drinks were made well and had the perfect amount of strength.   Bread and butter - very good! They use Real butter!!  Green beans - Too salty Mac n cheese - Disgusting, tasted smoked Cream of corn - Only ok, I've had better  Tuna - My friend said, incredible!

This steakhouse is fantastic. They're extremely accommodating. The staff is outstanding. G, Faith and Juda the bartenders are some of the best I've ever met. Travis the manager is extremely friendly and treats all of the guests here excellent. The food is phenomenal. Highly recommend going in on any night, sitting at the bar and having dinner and drinks.

YUM-ME! The steaks at this place are pretty awesome. I ordered the steak and lobster tail and got pretty full. Their specialty drinks are awesome. My friend ordered a couple of side dishes, but I was too full to eat any of them.

Great service and good food. Loved the cheesesteak egg rolls, iceberg salad and ribeye! We tried all sides and they were equally yummy. Especially the mushrooms ! Our table setup was angled oddly, but we made it work.

This is my #3 steakhouse in Charlotte and yes, for me, it's still 5 stars. You might say I've never been to a steakhouse I didn't like, but that would not be true, as there are a few out there. Sullivans has a great bar area w/music and a cool outdoor patio open year round. Can't beat the specials on Thursday & Sunday nights. Sunday they do their $30 3-course meal along with $5 Knockout Martini, which is similar to the stoli-doli at Cap Grille. Same drink special on Thursday with cheap bar bites.   The menu is awesome and the wine list extensive. I always order the filet and onion rings...yep, great combo. Wine or scotch...or both?! Great for special occasions or just a late meal. Try it on a Sunday...always busy after Panthers games.

Went for dinner last night, first time since the remodel. The bar area seemed nicer but I have to admit I preferred the charm the restaurant had before. My wife had the Filet it was tasty. I had Lobster tails they were also yummy. 1 thing I found weird was the clarified butter was real thick (not typical) I did not care for it. Our server was sort of an odd older gentleman. He did do his best, but sort or Over pushed a bottle of wine...it was pretty funny. All in all the visit was fine but not sure it was worth the money with so many other choices.

I also tried Sullivan's during restaurant week. I would not return. The meal began as a disappointment and ended that way.   I began my meal with a Caesar salad. The salad was large but the lettuce was wilted and the croutons were soggy. It was apparent they had prepared the salads much earlier that day, croutons and all, and placed it in the refrigerator. It may have even been prepared the day before. Before our salad plates were removed from the table our steaks were brought out with no where to place them. The four of us literally had to hold up out salad dishes while they placed our steaks on the table.The steak was cooked to order but the potatoes that were served with it had so my much horseradish in them they were inedible. The cheesecake was warm and pretty much tasted like a Sara Lee purchased from the grocery store.   Our service wasn't much better. The waiter whizzed by a couple of times and asked if everything was ok. Each time his hands were full and he never came to a complete stop.   At first I blamed restaurant week, but have been to numerous restaurants over the years and have never experienced such a disappoint. I will never return to Sullivan's and would NOT recommend it to anyone.

Our server, Lauren, was awesome.  She had great recommendations for beverages and dinner.  We were there celebrating our anniversary and had a great time.  We had the Filet feature with mac and cheese, creamed cheese (a must order!), gnocchi and mushrooms (there were too many great sides to choose from!).  We have eaten here many times and it has never disappointed.  I would highly recommend this restaurant to anyone!  They brought us a complimentary dessert since we were celebrating.  Can't wait to go back again!

Thank you Natasha and Sullivan's! What a wonderful experience we had for our son and daughter-in-law's Rehearsal Dinner there last Friday night. We could not have been happier with how it all turned out. Natasha was such a pleasure to work with - her attention to detail, professionalism and helpfulness went above and beyond. She made sure everything was perfect for our event, right down to helping us decorate the private room (which took almost 4 hrs. but looked beautiful when finished!) and attending to our every need. Our three servers, (Spencer, Evan and Amy) were excellent and the food was delicious. All of our guests had a wonderful time and the evening was a huge success! I would highly recommend Sullivan's for your next special event and cannot say enough about their event planner Natasha Demaio and the expert care she took to help ensure our guests had a wonderful evening and our very special dinner was a perfect event!

Nice low-key steakhouse. Easy to drive right past if you're not looking closely for their sign. Offers valet parking. Cheesesteak eggrolls are BOMB! A la carte sides were lacking, we did the season-less broccoli and an gratin potatoes, which more closely resembled a smashed plain baked potato. Salmon Rockefeller was phenomenal and Hubby liked his Oscar style filet, but said there are better available here in Charlotte. Overall, super awesome experience. Love the cozy, intimate seating and friendly staff. Seemed to be very accommodating to the large group that was there during our time too! Give Sullivan's a try!
Had a really good filet mignon and scallop potatoes! Really great service too! I would definitely go back.
Food was great, service wasn't bad. A little over priced for their servings but overall satisfied
Sullivans is a classic - excellent food and superior service, anytime but restaurant week.

Passing through Charlotte on business and decided to try Sullivan's.  It is a good, solid steakhouse.  I had the Kansas City Bone-In Strip and it was perfectly cooked and tender, unfortunately, a little too much pepper.  Otherwise the sides were tasty: White Cheese Au Gratin Potato and Asparagus.  I liked the dark interior with hints of art deco.  The service was prompt, attentive and friendly.

I've been to Sullivan's in Baton Rouge and had excellent service every time- the waitresses and bartenders were prompt and very cordial. I went here this evening in Charlotte and ate at the bar...my meat was cooked incorrectly, the bread was the last item to hit the table, and I was overcharged for an additional beer by the bartender. When I asked for the beer (since I had not received it), I got blown off.   Upsetting. Not sure I'll go back. Be careful of your bill if you do.

First off, let me say that our waiter Chris was genuinely THE BEST waiter either of us have ever had. He was so amazing and attentive. When he asked what brought us here, we said we were visiting from out of town and heard good things. He went completely out of his way to make the meal special for us - he brought me a rose (although he claimed my man gave it to him to give to me;)), was super friendly and checked in on us throughout the meal, and gave us a free dessert to take home with us. He was literally the best and I can see why they put new servers with him! Secondly, the food - OMG. Amazing. Steaks are the best we ever had in our life! Try the New York strip with the bourbon peppercorn sauce - it was actually my date's food but I kept stealing bites! My filet was wonderful as well. The mashed potatoes were delicious and even the bread they give you as you sit is tasty too! And you must try the calamari as an appetizer! Chris recommended it to us and it was the yummiest calamari I've ever eaten. Honestly everything at Sullivan's is the best I've ever eaten. We live four hours away but we agreed we're making special trips to Charlotte for this steakhouse. We love Sullivan's!

Another great meal at Sullivan's and it just happened to be our anniversary.  After being asked a couple of times if we were celebrating a special occasion we gave in and told them it was our anniversary.  Well what was already a delightful dinner was made even better by the congratulations from many staff members and the complementary dessert and champaign along with a picture to commerate the occasion. It seemed a little corny at the suggestion, but we went along with it and it turned out well and they customized it with our details.  Overall it made for a great time.  It wasn't our first anniversary celebration there and will definitely not be our last.

I've frequented Sullivan's many times for lunch but this was my first dinner there.  We took advantage of their 20 year celebration and a special they had.  My husband had the prime rib and it was cooked perfectly rare.  I ordered the salmon rockefeller.  The salmon was on a bed of spinach and topped with Bearnaise sauce, bacon, and crab.  It was very rich and very good.  We both had one side with our entree and couldn't finish it all.  The cocktails were great and the service was awesome.  Jess took great care of us.  We ordered our dessert to go and because we were there celebrating my husband's birthday she brought him out some ice cream on a decorated plate.

We love going to Sullivan's.  I have been to the one in King of Prussia, PA (1) in Chicago (1) and the one in Charlotte (6).  We love jazz and this is the best place in Charlotte we have found to check it out, even better than Blue.  We like that we can go eat formal in the main dining area or take advantage of the happy hour and bar menu hanging out listening to jazz all night.  We have been there 6 times in 2011 and plan to go at least 1 Saturday per month moving fwd.  Considering it is close to an hour from our house, you can tell that we enjoy going to Sullivan's.  Service is great.  Jazz is great.  The food is an 8 out of 10.  Fairly pricey and you get more or less what you would expect.  We take friends with us about 50% of the time and they have all loved going and talk about it afterwards.

Previously, I have only been to Sullivan's to hang out in the cocktail area & order from the bar menu, but this review is for dinner in the dining room.    Now, generally, when I get to pick the place, my first choice would NOT be a chain restuarant, even an upscale one.  But, as it turns out, we had a gift card that could be used at either Del Frisco's or Sullivans. So, I went online to research menus ahead of time. Based on the menu (specifically the Ahi Tuna steak entree) I decided that we should go to Sullivans.      Needless to say, I was SUPER DISAPPOINTED to learn that they were out of Ahi tuna since that was the whole reason I decided to opt for Sullivans.  BUMMER!!  (I could see a smaller locally owned place running out of a popular menu item, but a huge corporate chain like Sullivans should have a better idea from their POS system about how much of certain items to keep on hand in the restarurant at any given time.)  So, I purused the menu to explore my options...sadly for those who don't eat steak (like me), the rest of the seafood or poultry options were not really exciting.  Oh well, c'est la vie.  But, as a small consolation prize, they had the Knockout martini on special for $6 (which normally is around $12)... so I started with that.  The knockout is made of clementine vodka that has fresh pineapple steeping in it for at least a week.   It was somewhat sweet, but not cloyingly so. I enjoyed it very much. 4.5 stars.   I decided to opt for one of the Sunday Prime-time specials.  For $34 a person, you can select one item from each of the following categories (however, beware, they have fairly limited options in each category):  (1.) Salad or soup,  (2.) An entree, (3.) A side dish, and  (4.) Dessert.  To go with my entree, I ordered with a glass of Sauvignon Blanc.  For $8, I got a fairly generous pour of an ok wine. 3 stars.   I started with the wedge salad.  3.5 stars.  The salad was huge and slathered with lots of bleu cheese dressing and a little finely chopped tomato. (At least they aren't one of those restaraurants that feels compelled to automatically throw bacon on everything.  I was glad this salad comes without.)  For my entree, I went with the salmon w/buerre blanc sauce.  The salmon was a decent size and thankfully was not overcooked. The sauce wouldn't have been my first choice if there were other options, but it tasted fine.  Overall, I would give this item 4 stars.   The side dishes on the special menu are very limited, and unfortuantely didn't include asparagus.  So, I went with the only other green option, the creamed spinach.  This dish was loaded with parmesan cheese and cream. It was ok, but I couldn't eat much of it because it was way too rich. 3 stars.   The dessert was fairly disappointing from my standpoint.  I love a good bread pudding, so I was excited about trying the Bannas Foster bread pudding.  This was made in individual ramekins and had a couple of slices of bananas in it.  It was also topped with ice cream, whip cream, and a drizzle of what looked like a carmel sauce.  Sadly, it was not very flavorful and the bread pudding had almost a rubbery texture. 2 stars.    David also got the wedge salad and chose the filet mignon for his entree.  He said the steak was over-salted.  He also chose mushrooms for his side and I tasted them - they were also a little over-salted. I couldn't eat more than a couple of these. For his dessert, he got the cheesecake to take home, since our server told us that we might want to split one dessert in house and take the other one to go (this  was a good suggestion because otherwise, it would be way too much!)  He also ordered a Highland Oatmeal Porter to go with his steak.   Our server was nice, but the service was only ok - not great. One small thing we noticed is that some tables had bread served to them and some (like ours) did not.  Since this was my first time eating in the dining room at Sullivans, I don't know if you were supposed to order the bread, or if the server just forgot to bring it.  (Not a huge deal, but it would have been a nice touch.)   Another small thing I noticed was no manager going around the dining room to greet patrons.   Overall, I was just not impressed given that our total bill came to $94 before tip.     I would come back here to meet friends for cocktails & casual bites from the bar menu, but I would not come back for a full-fledged dinner.  There are just too many other great restaurants in Charlotte to choose from at this price point.
Five stars- all the way!!! Excellent wine list, appetizers, sides, desserts, and most importantly- steak! Looking forward to coming back!

Sullivan's was perfectly decent.  We were there on a Wednesday night, and the place was packed.  It was so loud, my husband and I could barely hear each other.  We both did the Prix Fixe.  I had shrimp cocktail, shrimp & lobster bisque, and the 6 oz filet oscar style.  Hubby had calamari, shrimp & lobster bisque, and an 8 oz filet.  I also ordered a side of macaroni and cheese for us to share.  Both of our apps were good.  The shrimp and lobster bisque had a really nice and complex flavor.  I probably enjoyed it most of all, but it could have used more seafood pieces.  Our steaks were fine, but really nothing to get too excited about.  The oscar topping flavor was too overpowering, in my opinion.  I liked the horseradish mashed potatoes.  The mac and cheese was actually shells and cheese...I don't recommend it.  It wasn't bad, but I've had better for a lot less money.  Dessert was on the house since it was my birthday.  Our server suggested the bread pudding, but I went with the s'mores cake because I wanted chocolate.  I probably should have gone with her suggestion.  The s'mores cake was more of a s'mores pie, and was rather underwhelming.  The service was okay.  There were times when my husband's sweet tea sat empty, which I don't think is okay when you're paying so much for a meal.  All in all, it was fine, but overpriced for the quality of the food and service.  Next time we want to do a high-end steakhouse, we will try a different place.

Excellent service !!  Live music outside on the patio.   Loved the kale salad !   I had the salmon,,  so good.    It has been remodeled since I was there before  great bar area ,,  they have small rooms for meetings.     Great sides creamed spinach,  mac and cheese and creamed corn is fantastic

When I first went to Sullivan's 10+ years ago, I treated it as an upscale "I need to dress to impress" steakhouse. The second time I went (last year, thinking the same way), I had my boyfriend dress up. Well, when we got there, people had on shorts & flip-flops! Ah well, I digress...  The steaks are yummy & the a la carte sides are delicious. I went with the caesar salad, filet mignon, creamy horseradish mashed potatoes & green beans. My bf got filet mignon, creamed spinach & the same mashed potatoes. So delightful!  The staff is very attentive, the restrooms & restaurant are clean. The bar out front is very relaxed & I love that they have jazz sometimes.  The patio is nice, as well.  Sullivan's is quite pricey, so I have to reserve it only for special occasions.

First off I've been to Sullivan's a hundred times in Raleigh and a couple times at this location in Charlotte.  I don't know what it is but I guess I just pick the worst nights to come here.   The first time they told me it would be a 45 min wait and I waited 2 hours before I was seated just to find out they were basically out of everything on the menu.  I actually banned coming back until I was invited here for a Christmas dinner this year.  I know this is a very busy time a year in the restaurant business but when you pay this much for food - I expect   1.)  Appetizers to not take 45 min to come out & be cold 2.) Waiter to not throw away our leftovers after we have asked for a box 3.) When the man at the table already seems annoyed by your service and then you persist on throwing the dessert menu in his face (let's just say not a good move on your part) *he is paying the bill  It sucks because I really like Sullivans steak and in Raleigh I have always been happy with my food and service.

Sullivan's is Great.  I like the dark setting and the boxing decor.  This was probably my fourth time here and I just noticed a serious old school boxing championship belt on the wall near the hostess podium.  Pretty sweet.  Anyway, we went last Sat night and we were seated fairly quickly (with reservations).  We were celebrating a birthday and it appeared there were about 2 or 3 other birthday's going on that night as well so it was full of large groups.  Not a problem.  They were doing the restaurant week menu and everyone opted for that.  I had the "Steak and Potatoes" option.  Medium rare.   The steak came out nicely and they chilled a red wine for us that someone at our table had specifically asked for. Seasonings were good on the food and good char on the steak.  The dessert options were limited for Restaurant week, but the chocolate mousse was a nice finish.  The server was friendly and attentive.  Although there is one woman who is my favorite.  Cant remember her name.  She is on the top section.  The service was not too slow and they did not rush us either.  Even though we end up spending about two hours there.    I still really like Del Friscos even though it is overpriced, but I think Sullivans may have won me over.

I took my parents for restaurant week, as they just moved to the area. We waited 45 minutes for a table, even with a reservation. Our meals were good but our waiter was for some reason short and somewhat curt with us (my friend dining with us used the word "snarky," which is also fitting). It felt like he didn't really want to be there, and certainly not serving us. I wish we had gone to Capital Grille instead, I find they always treat you like royalty.

This is the best Sullivan's I have been to.  The Bartender, Luke, is VERY knowledgeable, and friendly.  I eat here for lunch about once a week, and am there for dinner every now & again.    I have yet to have a bad meal.  Service is always very friendly, and if something does go wrong (happened 1 time) the management was extremely understanding & helpful.  For my money, it rarely gets better than Sullivan's in Dilworth - for the complete package.

Very nice. Straight forward, rather English in decor...  they have a room downstairs for banquets and groups that is very nice. The meat choices are fresh and deliciously prepared, in fact I would say on par with Morton's and Ruth's Chris at a slightly more palatable price point. The staff was very professional and everything was nicely done.  A good solid dining experience.
We loved the live music. Good customer service. A great dinner deal for two. Most of all, we were  really content with the food. We hope to visit again in the near future.

I don't normally give five stars but will in this case. Everything was great at this place while in town this weekend.   Love the location, south end with a lot of good places to chose from to eat and drink. Right off the light rail which we took from downtown.   We wanted to watch March madness so we sat outside with perfect weather.  Started out with the wedge and also we ordered a kale salad.  Pretty standard for steakhouses  We got the ribeye and New York cooked perfectly medium rare with mushrooms and hash browns for sides.  Also a side of bernaise for both.  Mushrooms were amazing and the steaks had just the right amount of seasoning.   Good drinks, food, service, and atmosphere.  Can't wait to get up to Charlotte.
Great place to eat the employees are excellent, and great atmosphere Samantha is extremely professional

I went to Sullivan's for lunch today.  The food was pretty good- but the service had a lot of room for improvement.  I went in at about 12:30 PM and sat at the bar.  There were a few other patrons in the restaurant.  The bartender was friendly enough, but not overly engaging.  But it was clear that the servers did not have their collective act together today.  Here are a few examples:  1.  Although sitting at the bar, the food always came in on the side with someone literally scaring me the first time they presented food at the table. 2.  The bartender, from approximately ten or so feet away, called at me "do you want bread and butter?" 3.  The phone must have rang ten times before anyone answered it even though there was someone at the door (where the phone was located) who welcomed persons in. 4.  Even though I saw a bunch of other servers and the place was not really very busy, the bartender was serving and busing other tables instead of taking care of customers at the bar.  Don't get me wrong...everyone was friendly, but the service was below what you would expect of a restaurant of this caliber, and with fairly high prices.  The food itself was good.  I had a Caesar salad, salmon and mashed potatoes.  Portions were adequate, but not overwhelming in size.  But it all tasted quite good and I felt I got my money's worth.  My "go-to" high caliber, high-price steakhouse in Charlotte continues to be Capital Grille.  Sullivan's could learn a lesson or two from them.

We went to Sullivan's June 18th for Father's Day and had a wonderful time.We had an 11:30 reservation in order to beat the crowd and it was well worth it. I'm sorry I don't have the waitress' name, but she was a blonde young lady who took perfect care of us, attending to our needs, but letting us enjoy our dinner in privacy too. We all used the Sure Thing menu and had the seafood bisque (the real deal with chunks of seafood you can see and taste), filet mignon, complete with mashed potatoes, Italian bread and creamy butter, and a choice of dessert ( cheese cake, key lime pie or banana pudding). All this for $44 a person. It was outstanding! Thank you Suliivans! And thank you to the new manager from Indianapolis who was on the job one day but still greeted all the customers!

Absolutely loved Sullivans!  Drinks: Try their Pinot Noir that starts with an S, this Pinot had great body and I enjoyed a couple glasses. They have many options of wines, but this was the only one by the glass. Starter: I am a lover of Seared Rare Ahi Tuna but the spicy mustard sauce was too much. Other than that, the tuna was a good option. Salad: Split the wedge. It was very crisp, and the blue cheese was very flavorful! Entree: I loved the Filet Duxelle Mushroom Stuffed 8oz steak! Very delicious and I highly recommend! Side Dishes: Ask for the Loaded Baked Potato FULLY loaded! They put the white cheddar cheese sauce on it that they use in their Mac and Cheese. This was along with the normal loaded options. Delicious! The Steakhouse Skillet Mushrooms were great too! I'm clearly a fan of mushrooms... Dessert: Go for the seasonal Peanut Butter Black Bottom Pie! Don't even hesitate on this one if you like peanut butter. Presentation was beautiful and I loved the salted peanuts, caramel, and chocolate shavings that topped this amazing dessert! Will be back!

I been here quite a few times.. Many gathering and birthday parties. This year, the girls and I decided it's best to ring the New Year with Sullivan's.. For this day. They have a set menu. Many choices you can pick from in each categories.. I have Evan as our waiter this time.. and per usual their customer service have alway been on point.. I'm not sure if the kitchen was slammed. But this time the steak is bit too tough and a little more done than I would like but any other times, I'm completely satisfied.. looking forward to many more celebrations at Sullivan's!

The food was excellent as usual at Sullivan's. The filet medallions were great and the bone in ribeye excellent. The banana foster bread pudding was the perfect dessert. Alex our server was very attentive. The manager Stephanie went out of her way to make party feel at home.

This place was amazing! My husband brought me here for my birthday and they gave me a rose and treated both of us really great.  He made reservations for us before the big dinner rush and after we sat down that's when it started getting crowded.  I've been wanting to come here for the longest and finally we came and we got:  The summer fling The New York strip 12oz, au gratin potatoes  2 waters Raspberry belini  Chocolate cake with raspberry sauce and vanilla ice cream  For a total of 150 Not too bad in my opinion  WE LOVED EVERYTHING! We're definitely coming back a lot more.

This is a good mid tier steakhouse in my opinion. I think it's a little more casual than BLT or Delfriscos. I do like the 3 course option and I think it's a reasonable price for what you get.y food has always been well prepared and the wait staff have been helpful friendly and knowledgeable.

Went here for Valentines dinner, and had a delightful dinner. Both of our steaks were perfection as well as our sides which included mushrooms, mashed potatoes, and a baked potato. The Pineapple Martini was an absolute knockout!!! You must try the bread pudding for dessert!

Sadly, I have to say my last experience was not really that great.  We went for our anniversary back in October.  Our waiter was fantastic he deserves 4 stars, but the food was just ok, the wine list was very expensive, the environment was pleasant but it didn't have the feel of pride, hip and clean like it has in the past.  This was one of our favorite "special treat" places for years.  I'm sad that it wasn't great.  We may give it one more try just because it was so great before and everyone can have a bad night, but we're still on the fence on returning.

YUM! I know this place is a chain, but it was so friggin good.  Luckily my boss took me here ( hello open credit card), and it couldn't have been a better experience.  We had the seafood platter and calamari to start.  Both were excellent.  Now lets get to the bulk, the steaks. I had a 12 oz filet which was a great cut of meat.  I asked for medium and they cooked it perfectly.  The perfect amount of pink on the inside. My other coworker got the 22oz cowboy cut which was just absurd.  His skinny butt somehow finished the whole thing.  Beyond this, the service was outstanding.   Pros: everything you could want  Cons: A bit pricey, but hey you get what you pay for. Plates are about $35-$55.

I have been here a few times and am a big fan. The food is always amazing and the service prompt. I have had the ribeye and fillet and they were both delicious. The sure thing menu is a great addition to the regular menu. This place is pretty expensive so I only go for special occasions.

I brought the ladies of the office here for lunch on International Women's Day this year. The staff was really great and accommodating. They let us do the sure thing pre fixe menu even though it was lunch time and not dinner. All of the food came out really well and very tasty including dessert. Everyone was really pleased with how things went and no one had any complaints about their food. I wouldn't say this is the best steakhouse I've every been to but honestly it is really good, their drink options are great, and the staff is amazing. You really can't go wrong by coming here.

For a year my husband and I ate at Sullivan's any Thursday we were in town, over 27 times according to my card. We really enjoy eating outside when the weather is nice...but we had to come early or the 'band' would set up and play. Oh my goodness...this guy makes my ears bleed. I cannot believe anyone wants to listen to that 'sound'.   And then April...oh my heavens...the WORST server on the planet. Seriously. We had a horrid experience after a positive prior experience, reported to the manager about it and from that point forward, she was a nightmare for us anytime she worked and we were there. We started doing dining room only because she made the time in the patio or bar so uncomfortable.   Natasha is an AMAZING server--always ask for her!  Mike and Mary are FABULOUS managers who rotate through the restaurant and make sure things are great...but oh that April...she's a pill and frankly, the reason we have not returned in 2016. Which saddens me because it's otherwise wonderful, but having the stink eye anytime she's there is a big negative for us.   The food---GREAT! Parking--okay, not a fan of valet services so self-parking = a little bit of a hike Dining room--wonderful ambiance Bar--great drink menu Desserts--PHENOMENAL

Visited for restaurant week. My family and i all ordered the filet mignon with soup or salad with a side of mashed potatoes and chocolate mouse for dessert. We also ordered a side of sweet potato casserole. Our experience: the atmosphere was very nice and friendly even on a busy Wednesday night for restaurant week. No issues with service. Ceasar salad was good but did not care to much for the shrimp and lobster bisque. I did not like the color or care to much for the flavor. The soup was just okay but would not get it again. Our steaks were prepared and cooked to perfection! The mashed potatoes were prepared with a horse radish which none of us cared for. I finished mine but my wife and daughter did not. The big hit was the side of sweet potato casserole which pretty much could be considered a dessert because it was so sweet and delicious. Desert was chocolate mousse. We compared the mousse to Mortons downtown where we dined on Monday. Both Mortons and Sullivan's mousse were delicious but my wife and daughter preffered Sullivan's and I picked Mortons mousse as the winner. I thought Mortons was richer and had more flavor. We will definitely go back and reccomend Sullivan's.

I had the lobster and steak; it was amazing!!  I was traveling but this meal made my trip more enjoyable.  Would have had 5 stars but the sides, lowest cost per side was $3, were pretty bland at times. We had 9 people in our group and 1 out of the 5 sides we got was good. The others was just okay; but that's not okay bc each individual side is its own cost.  That being said, I will definitely go back. Although it wasn't ordered, the MacNCheese side I was told is amazing.

Excellent experience.  Went for our anniversary.  We were seated promptly to our table with rose petals on it.  We did mention it was our anniversary when making the reservation.  Our waitress, Diana, congratulated us and took our drink order.  Service was prompt and she was quick to answer our questions.  We had the filet and the rib eye.  Both were cooked a nice medium rare as requested.  At the end of the entrees, Diana, came over and let us know dessert was on them, so we're got the cheesecake to share.  It was yummy.  Then, Joe, the manager came over and congratulated us on our anniversary and thanked us for celebrating at Sullivan's.  All in all a great experience.

Delicious and expensive place for an excellent steak dinner. Service is excellent. We did the Sunday special for $40 each that was a 3 course meal. Ended up being a better price since this place is a la carte like many nice steakhouses are. The service was absolutely wonderful and we will definitely return.

This is probably close to being, if not my favorite restaurant in Charlotte. The decor sort of has that art deco, 1930's feel to it. I have dined here three or four times and also stopped in for dessert and a drink. Thursday night they usually have a jazz band. They also have a decent, very affordable bar/late night menu. For dinner I have had their steak, crab legs and sea bass which have all been excellent. We weren't able to get in anywhere around here (Lake Norman area) for restaurant week last year at the last minute so we made reservations for Sullivan's and drove right down. I also enjoyed their chocolate covered strawberries at the bar around Valentine's Day. As far as drinks go they make great martini's and have a decent wine selection.

My husband and I ate here last Thursday and I was excited to try Sullivan's because I've heard great things about it! It started off great. Our waiter was great (I want to say his name was Ken but I'm not positive). Anyway, I ordered the salmon plate (super yummy) and my husband ordered the steak that was on special that night. Everything was great until a waitress brought us our food. She asked my husband to cut open the steak to make sure it was cooked to his liking (medium rare). He cut it open and looked inside but the restaurant is SO dimly lit that he couldn't see. So he was pulling out his phone and telling her that he was going to turn the flashlight on to make sure it's cooked properly. She didn't wait for him to do that and instead bolted. Our waiter came by to check up on us as my husband was checking the steak with his phone flashlight and it was literally mooing. I mean, it was basically just seared on the outside and completely raw on the inside. Moooooooing. So our waiter took it away, they put it back on the grill to get it cooked through a bit more and returned with it a few minutes later. Ok so, three things: I ate my entire meal alone cause I'd rather not eat cold salmon by the time they returned with the cooked steak. Second: they just stuck his steak back on the grill. Not a new steak. For the prices we pay there, I expect a new steak. Third: the manager came back with the cooked steak and simply apologized for the mooing steak. I expected that we'd be comped in some way. Or a free dessert. Or just anything to make up for their terrible mistake. But no. Nothing. Nothing was done to truly correct their error. We didn't have any time to speak with anyone or fight anything cause by the time dinner was over, we had to be at a ballet in 15 minutes. It was a little disappointing that at a nice restaurant, they can't comp a meal when they made a big mistake and caused us to not even be able to eat our dinner together. That's a big deal to us because we NEVER get to go on dates (parents of two babies). And we only get to eat dinner together twice a week. So we'd like to eat together when we get to go on a raaaaare date. Anyway, needless to say, it was a disappointment. Food was good but the lack of action on their part was a little crappy. Not sure if we'll ever return.
As far as steakhouses go, I'd say this place is in the middle.  Service was great, but food was nothing memorable.

Last Friday was my first visit to a Sullivan's Steakhouse, and I have to admit I was impressed. I've frequented chain Steakhouses before; Morton's, Ruth Chris', Capital Grille, etc... and Sullivan's definitely ranks up there as one of my favorites (Capital Grille, not being one of them!).   Definitely start with the Crispy Shanghai Calamari and the Iceberg Lettuce Wedge Salad...both are amazing! The salad had a blue cheese dressing which I liked...and I do not generally like blue cheese! I had the Chili Crusted Ribeye...delicious. My fiance had the Pan Seared Sea Bass Hong Kong Style, which I liked, but she wasn't in love with. My in-laws went for the 3 course dinner for 2, and at $79, it was definitely a good deal!   A little on the pricey side, as Steakhouses can be, but a good meal with great service for the price tag.   PS: Order a Mojito...best I ever tasted.

I made reservations for 5:15 and got there at 5 with zero wait time...perfect! The waiter was very friendly...perfect! I ordered the Blue Crab Stuffed Shrimp ( from seasonal menu) perfect! My bf ordered 12 oz Filet Mignon...perfect! The dessert was Banana bread pudding with ice cream...awesome!! And I don't even like bread pudding !! This is a must have restaurant!

1/13/2017 I took my daughter here to celebrate her 18th birthday. The experience was flawless. The food was amazing; all of it. The best part was the service, My server Cristhia was awesome, kind, thoughtful, and genuine.  Mary, Cristhia, Jessica, and the whole staff, thank you; I appreciate everything you did to make this day special for my daughter. I will be back!

Love the knock out drink, love the lamb, love the cowboy if they cook it right, love the Grande Marnier Souffle the most.  What I don't like is the really poor service.  We have eaten here a dozen times and service is hit or miss.  Went in their twice and got rare cowboy steak when I asked for medium.  I know it's hard to cook, but...The second time it happened they brought it out three times. The first time it was raw with barely any marks, the second time it was medium rare, then they left it on till it was black and the manager came out with it and tried to convince me it was medium.  No apologies, no fresh steak, no free desert.  I did not eat it or send it back and no one cared.  At those prices I was fed up.  My husband an I tried to give it another shot recently after seeing a movie.  We went in to get drinks and a dessert.  The kitchen was closed a few minutes before we sat down.  We asked if we could get a cold desert, peice of bread, or a pretzel?  Nothing, just drinks.  After one with out food, we were done.  Sad to say Sullie's is comin' off the list.  :(

Atmosphere was really nice. Parking great! FOOD WAS AWESOME!!! Yes Sullivan's was pricy but for the great  food and great staff.. it was worth it! I had the Sea Bass, it melt in my mouth like cotton candy(THE BEST BASS I HAVE EVER HAD!!)  and my husband had cowboy rib eye(in which he said it was "OK". PLEASE NOTE: All meals are À la cart. Drinks was pricey, $12 for house wine. I WOULD GO BUT BACK! Great place 5 stars from me!!

I will NEVER go there for Thursday Happy Hour again.  This used to be one of my favorite spots to meet up with friends.  From the staff that was difficult in working with a group of 10 to the rude patrons that keep coming up to us to get our table- total disappointment!!

Not a fan of chains but I had been wanting to go here for a while to try the steak.  The food is good but the service you get here is top notch. Great place to celebrate an event such as a birthday or promotion - just make sure someone else picks up the tab...wink wink.
The food was great. The adult beverage are awesome. The atmosphere was relaxing. The live music was fantastic.

Noms!  We sat at the bar, so I am not sure of the atmosphere in the restaurant, but the atmosphere in the bar was fairly mellow.  I had an 8oz fillet  Mignon and a wedge salad.  The salad was drowned in dressing, but that can be prevented in the future by ordering it on the side.  The only negative thing I have to say about the steak is that they wanted me to order all kinds of crap to put on top of it.  A good, proper steak only needs to be served with a side of au jus!  The meat was properly cooked, and I ate the whole thing.  On Sunday nights, the drink menu is half price, so I had 2 froofy martinis.  They were pretty good too.  Our server was very nice as well, and did her job well.  This place is also fairly gluten-free friendly, but as with any place, you have to remind the staff over and over that no, you can't have the bread and butter that they placed in front of you, and that is a bit irritating.

Get to the Chase:  Pros: 1) Some dishes were amazing like the sea bass and bok choy with a soy glaze 2) Service is top notch 3) Very large room with plenty of space  Cons: 1) What pretends to be a swanky and posh restaurant, fails to deliver in the same level of quality in its food (ahi tuna was limp and mushy, had 3 different meat dishes but all tasted the same and were over-seasoned) 2) The restaurant is a clash between casual and dress-up...leaving you feeling a bit underwhelmed in a stuffy environment 3) Hosts at the reception lack the attention to detail and are too pre-occupied with whatever they're doing to notice when people walking into cloak rooms with the intention of the bathroom 4) Definitely expensive....$350 meal with 4 entrees, 2 appetizers, 1 dessert and a bottle of wine split between 4 people  Overall, a hit or miss. Great potential, some winning dishes, but overall not worth the money they demand.

This place was awesome! We went here for Valentine's Day dinner and had the prix frixe menu. They had a great selection!! We started with cocktails. I got the martini with blue cheese olives and my boyfriend got the sweet chocolatey specialty cocktail. They were great! I did order some more olive juice for my martini because I like them extra dirty. We then got the Caesar salad and shrimp and lobster bisque. The soup was incredible. For our entrees we got the lobster and filet that came with 2 sides. We got the garlic mashed potatoes and the lobster Mac and cheese. The Mac and cheese was okay but the steak and lobster was incredible. So were the appetizers. For dessert we got the chocolate mousse and the cheesecake. The chocolate mousse was very rich and good. All in all a great experience. The only thing that wasn't perfect was the timing. We did have to wait about 30 minutes or so past when our reservation time was but it wasn't too bad. I just wish they would have been a little more clear about the timing.
