We got a text 15 mins after our reservation time saying that our table was ready and then when we told the hostess we didn't get seated until about 15 or so minutes after that so we aren't sure if they had forgotten about us or not. But turns out they hadn't forgotten and we got seated and all in all it was a great experience!

The food is delicious and the service was great! The wine list will have something for everyone. If you need a suggestion try the Sequoia Grove Cabernet - it's pricey, but worth every penny. Excellent atmosphere for a variety of occasions. If you're not feeling like having a steak, try the Salmon - you won't be disappointed!
Perfect for: First Date A night out with spouse Nigh out for just drinks (specials are AWESOME)-sit at the bar A swanky place to pre-game
The food was mediocre at best for the price.  My steak was not cooked properly and the side dishes were boring .

I will never eat here again. I had ordered Medium Rare Ribeye. It was $44.00 and was cooked to medium. And was very very Salty.  I was offered another steak at no charge. It's a steak house, you have to get it right the first time. And I was not visited by the manager after complaining. Poor Customer Service.

One of my favorite places to dine in south Charlotte. The ambiance/ lighting is sexy in the bar area which is where I prefer to eat. The wait/ bar staff are positive & knowledgable. They always have my favorite champagne too Great place to go for a date night

I have to admit I only like this place on Wed. & Thurs. for their happy hour specials. I can get some great martinis for half price while having a cheap nosh too. The jazz music is always wonderful to relax out to (bit louder inside than out on the patio).  My one small complaint is the uniforms for the women are just awful! Being an upscale steakhouse one should not have women or any shape or size wearing short mini skirts with whatever black hose/fishnets/leggings/etc that they want. It makes this place go a bit down in class for me .  Had din din here one or two times...not bad, but not the best either. Would choose quite a few other steakhouses to have an elegant din.   All in all like I said the happy hour is well worth it!

My coworker suggested I check out the happy hour specials here and I was not disappointed. I ordered the cheesesteak eggs rolls, Sriracha shrimp and a blueberry lemon drop martini. Everything was flavorful and felt like a party in my mouth. I loved it!! To top it there was live music on the patio. The energy and vibe here was perfect. I'll will definitely be back for me!
Not s fan!!!!   Steak was covered in pepper and just wasn't very good considering the $42 price tag!   Sides are extra as well. Not impressed think I'll stick with beef and bottle!

Props to a Solid Steak House....  Sullivans has a very dark and swank atmosphere giving off a very upscale vibe. This is a personal favorite will living in Charlotte. It was my first experience with the lettuce wedge with diced tomatoes, blue cheese dressing, and crushed black pepper - just plain awesome. Their are known for their steaks which are tremendous. Big fan of the key lime pie for dessert. The wait staff is attentive and personal. If you are visiting/living in Charlotte give it a try, you will be glad you did.

Food was delicious, service was awful. Took approximately 23 minutes just to close the tab. We were initially given the wrong meal, had to order drinks multiple times, and never received any check ins from the waitress. Additionally, when we ordered a glass of water while closing out our tab, we were told the restaurant had run out of everything, including water.

4.5 stars. My daughter took us to Sullivan's Steakhouse. This was the second visit for me and my husband. The atmosphere is great, the food was delicious and the waitstaff attentive. We had an 8 oz. steak, potatoes, onion straws, wedge salad (daughter had Caesar salad) and dessert. My daughter had a 12 oz. steak. Complimentary bread is served before your appetizer arrives. Since we ordered our steaks well done I appreciated that our server asked us to cut into it to make sure it was done to our satisfaction. Mine was a little red on the inside so she took it back and returned a few minutes later with a perfectly done steak. It's the little things, you know?  They had a special, $39 per person, which is wonderful. But you have to ask for the special since it's not advertised. I think the price is reasonable for all you get, which was filling and delicious. I left there a happy camper. Definitely recommended.

We visited Sullivan's for dinner Saturday night and decided to start with a drink at the bar.  At 6:30 p.m., we were the only people in there... except for the jazz trio.  Now, I like jazz as much as the next person, but the bar at Sullivan's is fairly small and compact, and the music was pretty loud.  It was good but seemed a little unnecessary.  Our drinks (a dirty martini and a Cosmopolitan) were good, but not great, and were $26 together.  Onto dinner!  Our waiter greeted us and kept mentioning how he'd heard how much we liked Shiraz.  Huh?  He said he'd even send over the sommelier to help us pick a good bottle.  Again, huh?  I finally had to tell him that I thought they'd mixed us up with other people because we had cocktails at the bar.  He showed me his notes from our visit three years ago (tracked through OpenTable?) when we bought a bottle of Shiraz.  Ha!  I appreciate the attention to detail, but it seemed like a little bit of overkill, especially since it'd been three years, and there isn't really an alcohol we don't like.    The fella decided to go with the $39, 3-course menu and got the shrimp cocktail, lettuce wedge and steak.  The shrimp cocktail was fine (it's really hard to mess that up) and there were fewer shrimp than with the full-price appetizer; the lettuce wedge was okay but would've been even better with bacon; and the steak.... well, for Sullivan's being a steakhouse, it was pretty bland.  It almost tasted like bologna to me.  Yikes.  On a better note, I opted for the cheesesteak egg roll appetizer, which was delicious, and the chicken piccata entree, which was tender, moist, and seasoned perfectly.  We each got a glass of wine - not Shiraz! - and our waiter had some good suggestions on those.  I really wanted to have a great experience at Sullivan's, but for the price, there are much better steakhouses in Charlotte.  Bummer.

Since this is a Steakhouse expect it to be pricey.  Wine is expensive in all restaurants by the bottle so bring your own and pay the 25 dollar corking fee. Before they recently changed the menu the Salad use to come with the steak but that is not the case any more. The Sides are good for groups so share some. Sides to try is Mac and cheese with bread crumbs on top , Creamed corn, Garlic Mashed. I usually get the Filet or the Chicken even though it's a steak house. It's very tasty. The Chocolate moose is good but it's seasonal dessert. If you aren't up to spending the money try the Pre fix menu or wait for Restaurant week since they have great dishes to try for a great price.

BF and I wanted our last dinner in Charlotte to be a nice one so we came to Sullivan's on a coworkers recommendation.  I made reservations via Open Table on Yelp about 2 hours before we went to dinner.  Free valet service upon arrival (with tip, of course) which was kinda weird because some valet cars were parked right in front.   The place was almost full when we walked in.  Seemed like good business on a Thursday night.  The atmosphere and decor made it seem like an up-scale casual restaurant.  Service was on point for the whole night.  When I asked a worker where the restroom was, he actually walked me there across the restaurant instead of pointing or giving directions.  For appetizer, we started with raw oysters which were decently alright.  For entree, one of the specials for the night was a filet mignon trio dish in which the filets are prepared with 3 different toppings/sauces.  My bf ordered the rib-eye, medium rare.  My filets were pretty yummy, but my BF was disappointed with his rib-eye.  It was overcooked and the rib-eye that they serve here is not dry-aged.  He only ate half of his steak unfortunately.  Overall dinner was OK, but nothing too memorable.  We'll likely try another steakhouse in Charlotte next time I'm back in town for business.

Sullivan's is a favorite of my boyfriend and me. Of course, we thought it would be most befitting to have family and friends join us for his college graduation celebration dinner at our beloved Sullivan's.  We (party of 6) sat in the outside bar/patio area. Our server Marissa greeted us and introduced herself. Orders were placed, etc... the appetizers FINALLY arrived, however we did not receive any eating utensils. Upon request a few were provided, but not enough to accommodate all at the table. One of our guests had to go and ask for their own utensils, which never arrived, the table just shared what we were provided.  After over an hour wait, we inquired about the entrees, in which a different waitress was sent over, to advise us that Marissa was new, and this was not the initial incident of customers complaining, meanwhile, we consistently saw Marissa pass our table, and delightfully served the surrounding tables. We also noticed the manager speak with an adjacent table, however he failed to address our concerns, only the replacement waitress. After over an hour wait, our entrees arrived. Those of us that ordered the sure thing menu option, did not receive our soup/salads, and some entrees were incorrect all together. Sullivan's was a total disappointment and embarrassment to my boyfriend and I, as we had raved about the restaurant, and it was HIS celebratory moment that was ruined. We have frequented this location and well as the Raleigh, NC location (we' meet former Charlotte Manager, Aileen, who is currently the Raleigh, NC manager) on many occasions, and have never had to succumb to this level of poor and disappointing customer service.  Our party left dissatisfied and without most of their meals (salad, desserts).

Came here the other night on an extension of my best friend and I's indulgent outings.  We stopped in here after Nan and Byrons for martinis and an appetizer.  Completely blown away by the dirty martinis we had as well as the steak flatbread and bleu cheese wedge we shared. Everything was amazing! Its been a few days and I cannot stop thinking about that wedge salad. Great now I have to call her and go and do this all over again..... Yes this has to happen now........ The food was outstanding and I can only imagine what their steaks and entrees are like. I will have to also return with my guy soon so he can try.... and all my other friends until I run out of friends and I have to find new excuses to come as often as I want. We came on a Thursday and it was unexpectedly relaxed which main be the norm but it was my first time and for some reason I thought it was going to be a bit more fancy and stuffy but alas they had a live band and a good crowd and everyone seemed to be having a great time! The service was outstanding we sat at the bar as always.  I love the fact that they have a bar bites menu for a sort of happy hour. Definitely recommend this place for any occasion and I cannot wait to go (like in the next hour for sure since now I cant stop thinking about it)

Had dinner here last night everything was excellent One thing when I called to reserve a table I asked about the Sunday special price supper and was told they no longer had that Much to my surprise when I received the menu from our waiter it also hav a special 3 course menu for a price of $44.00 each with a nice choice of items We chose that menu and everything was Excellent  The people that answer the phone should know this Not knowing may keep some customers from coming into this restaurant
It was as advertised. It was a great choice  for  restaurant  week. Everything was grade A. Our server Chris was awesome and very knowlegeable  about the menu. I would highly recommend  this  place.

This place was superb in all respects: food, presentation, service, ambiance.  It really left nothing to be desired in a five-star steakhouse experience.  And the fact that the Chicago Bears picked up the tab made it all the sweeter. ;)  Our party of eight ordered the oysters Rockefeller, seared ahi tuna tartare, fried calamari, and seafood sampler appetizers.  I tried all but the last, and all were adequate-to-amazing.  The oysters Rockefeller were goeey-cheesy, spinachy and warm, with just the slightest tinge of salty oyster flavor beneath.  The ahi tuna tartare was fresh, perfectly seared and presented beautifully.  Even the standard calamari was above-average: warm and soft, not rubbery in the slightest.  My wedge salad with diced roma tomatoes, fresh-ground black pepper and creamy bleu cheese dressing was melt-in-your-mouth delicious.  The lobster bisque, presented with a zig-zag of cream down the middle, was a tad salty for my tastes.  But it did boast more than the usual amount of lobster chunks.  I've had better, but this was still good.  For my entree, I enjoyed the 12-ounce filet mignon with gorgonzola butter melted over it.  My date had the jumbo scallops with spicy Thai sauce.  Both were dazzling.  My steak was lean, immensely flavorful and perfectly prepared (warm and pink throughout, with no raw parts in the middle).  Our party ordered family-style sides: creamed spinach, asparagus with Hollandaise, horseradish mashed potatoes and au gratin potatoes.  I didn't try the spinach, but the rest were terrific.  And plentiful: nobody was left wanting for any of them.  For dessert, I enjoyed the bananas Foster bread pudding.  I'm normally not a bread pudding kinda guy, but it stood out on the dessert menu, so I gave it a shot.  I was not disappointed: hot, smooth, firm, with the perfect amount of banana, real whipped cream and vanilla bean ice cream.  The cappucino served with dessert was lukewarm, but the service staff came around and topped it off with fresh hot coffee.  Speaking of the service staff, they could not have been more attentive to all of the various mundane tasks that often get overlooked: refilling water glasses, whisking away finished plates, scooping up crumbs with those nifty crumb-scooper-upper thingies.  Our server's knowledge of the menu and specials was thorough, and he was beyond helpful and attentive.  I don't anticipate being in Charlotte again, but if I ever am, I will flock back to Sullivan's.  Please give it a try!
Very good overall.  We had the filet and the chicken.  Lobster bisque and kale/pecan salad are recommended.

My little brother had just turned 21, and as a Marine he didn't often get to enjoy delicious food so I wanted to treat him to a great steakhouse. After reading lots of Yelp reviews, I had decided on Sullivan's Steakhouse.  To reduce the wait, I originally made a reservation earlier in the week for 730, but when I tried to change it online it said that my reservation wasn't found. When I called, they acted like I wanted a new reservation, so to move on I just created a new one for 8 pm. We had a couple beers at Sycamore earlier in the night, so we walked over to Sullivan's and got there right at 8 pm. We were really hungry, but were told that they were running behind and it should only be about 15/20 minutes, we weren't pleased, but it was a nice night so we waited outside. At about 8:25, I went inside to check in again and they said that they were still waiting on tables.... then at 8:50, we were finally seated. I understand that sometimes the tables are running behind, but I definitely did not make a reservation to be seated almost an hour later. It would be great if they would have texted us that they were running late so that we could have stayed at Sycamore.   To counter this, the service from our waiter was spectacular. We got a free appetizer for our wait (no I didn't ask) and when we ordered the crab cakes the waiter gave us advice that with out 4 people, it might make more sense to get another appetizer. We definitely appreciated that advice!  We ordered 2 bottles of wine along with dinner, and ordered steaks along with some sides served tableside. I got the filet mignon, and it was perfectly cooked, buttery and melt in your mouth. I also got the Cajun butter, which is butter that has Cajun spices that you can put on your steak (which then melts.) I liked how they didn't automatically add it so you were able to control how much butter is on your steak. We got the mushrooms, asparagus, king crab gnocchi and garlic horseradish mashed potatoes. My favorite was definitely the king crab gnocchi- spicy and creamy, with chunks of jalapeños.  You probably only need about a side per person maximum, as they are large in conjunction with the steak. We were pretty full, but the waiter approached us and said that we could get any desert, on the house to celebrate my brother's birthday. I know that he was really excited and they even added a Happy Birthday message! He got the Peanut Butter Pie, and it was rich, fluffy, with thinly sliced chocolate pieces on top and a chocolate black bottom.  We spent about $400 for 4 people, including 2 bottles of wine. We did get the appetizer and a desert for free, but overall I think it is expensive but reasonably priced based on the quality of the food and the service. I was disappointed with how they handled the reservation, but everything other than that was incredible.

Myself, along with my wife, aunt, cousin, stepdad and mom went here to celebrate my moms 60th birthday. This was her favorite place and where she wanted to go.   All of us had a range of experiences and overall, even with inconsistencies, we were very well taken care of. The manager made sure that anything that was wrong was corrected. My stepdad's steak was almost raw and he asked for medium. My moms asparagus was cold. My aunts hamburger had way too much pepper.   That said, my meal was cooked perfectly and it was very good. My wife and cousins meals were also perfect. I had the King crab legs and an order of Mac n cheese. Both were delicious. If the orders were consistent, which I would expect for this type of restaurant, it would easily be a 5 star. The only reason I'm giving 4 is due to the manager stepping in and making it all right.

Great high quality steak house. I like the shrimp cocktail, large shrimp, with spicy sauce. The filet and lobster include a lettuce wedge and blue cheese. Yes, I know Sullivan's is a chain. The quality is high and consistent.

I've been several times.  New Year's Eve 2013 most recent.  Bar can't make skinny margarita.  Oh well.  Steak was good but over salted.  Mushrooms over salted a lot but I liked them anyway.  The rest was great.  Chocolate covered strawberries were soooo good.   Surprised to see a visible layer of dust on wood rail next to our booth.  Not good.  Please clean well!!!  I'd go  back.

I would probably give Sullivan's a better rating if they weren't pulling a bait-and-switch for Restaurant Week. The hostess "forgot" to give us (and all the tables around us) the Restaurant Week menu and the waiter tried to get us to switch to their Summer menu - which is of course more expensive (and I don't mean he just suggested it, it was a hard sell). I seriously don't appreciate that - we were only trying the place BECAUSE it was Restaurant Week! Come on!  I did enjoy the food - once we got them to hand over the special menu. I was hoping their meat would be Del Frisco's quality since they are owned by them, but not quite. Would I go again? Maybe. The bar was cool and they had a good bar menu.   Please make sure you specifically ask for the Restaurant Week menu so you get the deal you came for! I really hope this isn't a new trend for restaurants during Restaurant Week, it's so tacky!

It was Charlotte Restaurant Week, so it still took us 20 minutes to be seated with a reservation... The hostess was pleasant, so it didn't put me in a bad mood... Our server was funny, attentive and knowledgeable... I love the wine list because you can order by bin number and not have to stumble your way through an order... (I can recognize a brand and a label but I am horrible at pronouncing some of the names... lol) The Caesar salad had just the right amount of dressing... I don't normally eat shrimp, but the ones that came with this NY strip steak were phenomenal... The steak itself was also very well prepared... I ordered it medium well and that is exactly how it came to the table... Just the slightest bit of pink and a nice texture... The mashed potatoes were pretty good and the vegetables were just basic... Luckily my boyf doesn't eat desserts, so I always get to try at least two for CRW... Last night's options were a Bananas Foster bread pudding and a chocolate mousse... I couldn't really get down with the bread pudding, but my friend seemed to love it... The mousse was a great way to end the meal, though!

We live very close to Sullivan's and have eaten there on numerous occasions. Some have been amazing and some not so great. In the past few years' we've made it a tradition to visit on Christmas Eve to 'treat' ourselves to a night out before the busyness of the next day rolls around.  This year we were happy to see they were not very busy even tho we were told on the phone they wouldn't be able to serve us. It's always me, my significant other and a single friend with whom we share our holiday eve with. We sat in the bar; the service was phenomenal. We thought the bill was pricey even with a $25 gift card, but we were cool with it.   We all shared the Calamari which was wonderful. My SO and I shared the filet/lobster tail entree, both of which were not very tasty. The lobster tail was so bland and came without butter. Our friend enjoyed his ribeye. We shared two vegetable sides, mushrooms and garlic mashed potatoes. The shrooms were average and the mashed potatoes were flavorless.  Coming away, we feel as if the quality/flavor of the food has really declined since our last visit and I felt a need to leave this message here.  We love our neighborhood spot and our holiday tradition, but not sure if we'll change it up next year or not.

This was better than I expected- it is New Years Eve and they are offering a fixed menu but none of us know what it's going to cost so we call the waitress over to ask- how much is it? $69 before 6 and 79 after. We get there before 6 but the bill still comes for the higher amount even though the check says we ordered at 5:47. Good was very good for sure and service was ok- she was a little distant as a waitress . The busboy was setting a table near us and knocked into my husbands chair a few times but never apologized . Some tables had New Years Party hats and others didn't- what's that about? Will return for good food just need to iron out a few things.

I give the restaurant a 3 based on what I would expect for cuisine and service for the prices on the menu.  Ate at the bar. Staff didn't seem to eager to get me a beverage or pay attention to me.  Steak was "ok."  Side of Broccoli was warm at best- was soon cold.  I just didn't feel the wow for the price.

I really expected to write a 4 star review for this place.  Let me begin by saying we decided to eat dinner here on a Thursday night.  We thought to ourselves, "oh it won't be crowded".  Wrong.  It was packed!  I had the bone in KC steak and it was stupendous!  Couldn't get a better cooked steak if I tried!  Where the rating starts to fall is the feeling of the place.  While the bar area seemed nice and warm and cozy.  The dining area with it's low booths and open area seating takes away from the experience in my opinion.  I want a little seclusion some times.  But all in all this place is a solid dinner choice.

We took my step daughter there for her 13th birthday as we wanted to take her somewhere nice and she wanted steak but we didn't want to drop a "Del Friscos" amount of money...the over all ambiance was nothing great , way too brightly lit for an evening dinner and the fact you have no choice but to valet park and They park your car right outside the door is a little much but I understand uptown parking can be an issue so no big deal there . Our server was nice, my finance's steak was more rare than medium so we did have to send that back and when I ordered my 2nd glass of wine the server came over and poured what was left of my old glass Into my fresh glass, which is a huge etiquette "no,no" especially at $15 a glass...  It was a nice treat and we like to try someone new every time we go out but I doubt we will going there again.

My family and I went to Sullivan's on Saturday, July 22nd to celebrate my sisters birthday. As soon as we walked into the establishment I was impressed by how attentive the staff was. Our reservation was on time and we were seated right away. Upon being seated we were greeted by our server, Bradley. Bradley was outstanding. He was attentive without being over the top, and personable. Bradley even went so far as to get me a side of the seasoning that was used on my steak to take home. The entire meal was outstanding. All steaks at our table were cooked perfectly. My mother is a vegetarian who hates fish, she ordered the salmon Rockefeller and was beyond satisfied. The next time I am in Charlotte, I will be going to Sullivan's. Hopefully Bradley is our server again.

I attended a dinner of 50 guys last week held on the patio. It's a tight fit out there but these folks really did a great job. While the dinner food was prepaid, drinks were on your own. These gals didn't miss a beat. Many of us ate steaks & while the strips needed a steak knife, they were prepared as ordered. That's not an easy task for such a large group.

Excellent steakhouse. Highly recommend the lobster bisque... very creamy. The filet mignon was cooked perfectly - nice and pink on the inside. For dessert, I highly recommend the bread pudding. The cheesecake is average.   As for service - we were seated right away which doesn't always happy at restaurants on a Saturday night even with reservations. Our waiter was very attentive though towards the end I felt a little rushed out.   My only critique would be a better beer selection. They only had a small number on tap.

Fine dining without the snobbery, Sullivan's in Charlotte is an excellent place to get some surf and turf. Great wait staff too. Took a bachelor party to eat there and when the food came out there were 6 very quiet guys chowing down on a great meal.  Funny rumor; beware of cougars at the bar.

I have eaten here 4 or 5 times when in town. The food and service are always very good and I have never had a bad meal here. The steak is always cooked perfectly and has good flavor. The mac and cheese and various vegetable sides are always good. The potatoes can be salty at times but still decent.  The atmosphere is pretty good although the dining room is a bit crowded at times. The service has been attentive and pleasant each time without having the kind of snobbishness you sometimes encounter at a good steakhouse. They have been genuinely fun and helpful every time.  I have had better steaks but Sullivan's has been consistently very good and I would recommend it to anyone looking for steak in Charlotte.
We always go to Sullivan's for most of our special occasions! Love this place! Can't say enough about the food or service!

Our reserved table was ready when we arrived. Seated immediately, server approached us with a big welcome, ice water poured within 3 minutes. Drinks/bread/entrees all served quickly. Both of our steaks were a bit overcooked. Our server Lynn, as well as the manager offered us new filets but we declined because they were still delicious. Received a free dessert to make up for the filets. Excellent customer service, delicious food. Beautiful ambiance. Can't wait to go again.

During a quick trip to Charlotte, we stopped in at Sullvian's in between apartment tours. Conveniently located in Charlotte's South End neighborhood, Sullivan's appears to be a great spot to grab lunch, dinner, or a drink. We arrived on a Tuesday just before they officially opened for lunch (11:30). To my surprise, aside from us there was only one other party waiting to be seated. And, throughout our short 30 minute stay I didn't see anyone else come in the door. We weren't really hungry for lunch, but we each ordered a bloody Mary. I think we were both in the mood for a drink with a homemade mix, but they use the premixed commercial stuff that you can find in just about any food store. The drinks were a bit on the weaker side, so we then transitioned over to wine (which, btw, we should have ordered in the first place). We didn't order any food as we ended up dining at the 7th Street Market later in the day.  Lastly, one of the highlights of our time at Sullivan's was the extremely friendly and outgoing bartender who, just happened to also be from Pittsburgh. We enjoyed talking with her and hearing about her experiences in Charlotte.  If we move into the area, we'd likely give Sullivan's another go.
Let me get to the point. This steak house is ok. We have other steak houses in Charlotte. Chris, Morton, Capitol,  Frisco, Palm and Outback. If you're searching for a good steak?

Good food, drinks and atmosphere. The Knock out pineapple martinis are amazing as well as their wedge and the scallops. The happy hour is great for afterwork get togethers. And don't miss out on sitting on the patio when its a nice night out.
Always good! We had a large party and our server was great! The food was fabulous as usual! If you want a good steak this is the place to get it! Definitely in my b top 5. Can't wait to visit again!

Great food! Great service! Great atmosphere! Three things I look for when I am heading out for dinner. April is the waitress to ask for. She works in the bar area and will make sure you dining experience is second to none.

I recently dined at Sullivan's with my boyfriend and it was a memorable experience to say the least. This is now one of my favorite steakhouses to eat in Charlotte. If you want a great dining experience with outstanding service and amazing food, this is the place to go. The price point is certainly not for conservative spenders, however for those that search for an overall experience rather than savings, will be rewarded with great service and delectable food. I look forward to my next visit.

I think I reviewed this already but....  You expect a great steak with great service to be a bit  expensive.  You get what you pay for.   There were 8 of us and we had reservations..  The service was great.  The food was great and the wine list was a book of great wines available at all prices.  I will be back to try their dry-aged bone-in rib eye.  All of us that the whole evening was wonderful.
This place has really gone downhill. Ate there last friday. Waitress had no clue about menu. Could not ring drinks in properly. Food was okay but service was below mediocre

Service reigns supreme to me.  Then, flavor is a close part B.   Today's call in then pick up was anything BUT flawless. I canceled Del Frisco's reservations so I could just pick up Sullivan's on the way home. Didn't feel like driving to South Park.   Anywhooz, today I learned Sullivan's is part of Del Frisco's corporate umbrella. Cool. I've had prior visits and didn't collect points but I will today.   Ordered the Sure Thing which is their 3 course price fixe. Arrived to no parking. Valet said just take handicap. So I feel uncomfortable and rushed.  I don't want to inconvenience any handicap placard or disabled person. I know the struggles.   Enter: no hostess.  I walk to bar. They redirect me to hostess stand.  I wait. She's sweet.  Gets ticket and it's double the cost. Someone didn't catch I asked for the "Sure Thing."   This took several attempts to fix including a manager saying it doesn't exist. Another Manger says it does and boom... the head Mgr fixes everything then exceeded my expectations with a bonus card for an official apology.   I was standing in the restaurant writing this 3 star review when it jumped to 5 because of how everyone took some extra initiative to WOW! the customer.   I didn't get the steak I ordered yet valet and mgmt were on par.  Why 3?  * I called back to inform someone that they didn't check us in for OpenTable. *I was told it was handled. I'm sure it was just some server passing by and answered the phone.  *minutes later I get the no show email from Open Table.  * There's room for improvement and I'm sure they'll make it. This won't deter me. Just taught me to dine in, always.

My husband and I like to try higher end steakhouses, especially for special occasions.  I had not tried this restaurant before. So he made a reservation for my birthday. I think they have a good menu and the food was very good, I got the bone in ribeye and he got the salmon. Both were well prepared. As an appetizer we did the calamari which was quite good.  That is why I am giving them 3 stars.  My issue is that the service was LACKING for what one would expect at a higher end restaurant. We knew we were going to have an issue the minute we were sat across from a party of 16 celebrating a 50 th birthday. It was a week night, the restaurant was not crowded but for some reason they sat a large party near the front along with several other parties bunched up around  that table, including ours. IMHO they should have seated a party that large away from others. The party was fairly tame but there were times when we could not hear each other because as with any group there is going to be a lot of conversation, and some will be louder than others. I fault management for seating several parties so close together around a large group while other tables near the back sat empty. Doesn't make sense and doesn't enhance the dining experience.  Our waitress was one of the people attending that table. Every time, regardless of whether the restaurant is high end or low end, when we have had a server attending a large party, we have felt shortchanged on service and that was the case here. Our service was delayed the entire meal- from removal of dishes, filling of water glasses,  serving of food. When we asked the server about the table, she flippantly stated oh it was just a group celebrating a 50 the birthday not 20 somethings, so it should not get out of hand. I thought that was an odd comment to make, and somewhat offensive. I am not sure why she had to go there. IMHO her answer should have been, don't worry I'll take good care of you or offered to move us.   My husband had advised that we were celebrating my birthday so she offered a free dessert from the menu- we did the warm chocolate cake which was good. He had planned to order coffee, but she left before he could even do so. Usually coffee is offered. She did not offer it. It felt like she was trying to wrap up us and get us out of there.  We paid the bill and when she returned his credit card, she thanked him by his first name!!  We felt that was unprofessional. Throughout the meal she had a very cavalier, casual attitude with us that I just didn't appreciate.  We chose not to make a scene in the dining area, but when we got to the hostess stand on the way out, we asked to speak to manager. A young manager came out to talk to us, apologized and offered his card with a promise of free drinks and appetizers at a future visit. I would try another steakhouse before coming back here. Restaurants need to remember that you only get one chance to make a first impression.
The filet mignon steak was cooked perfectly! Crime brûlée was delicious. Definitely worth the money

We took the extended family to Sullivan's (party of 8). I had the salmon which was very good. Daughter had sea bass which she liked and the rest of the crew had steaks and chicken and all were pleased with their food. Appetizers were some type of cheesesteak egg roll or something and everyone loved that. I thought the Calamari was very good as well. Service was good and prompt and they had 2 servers assigned to our table which was great. Our lead server was ok and that's the only knock. He was competent just seemed so scripted and rehearsed it didn't sit well with everyone. So would we return yes. Would we hope to get a different server, yes.

If you're in the mood for a fancy night out, celebrating a special event, or looking for an upscale place to have cocktails with coworkers, Sullivan's Steakhouse is the place for you. I came on a Wednesday around 6PM and the place was already packed! They have complimentary Valet parking that work off of just tips which eases the pain of trying to find parking in this busy spot. Luckily we were seated right away by the very welcoming hostesses who actually made you feel like they wanted you to have a great experience - which is a rarity.   Come here on a Wednesday. Drinks that are normally $11-$14 are discounted at $7 which is great way to save a few bucks and still feel fancy. Confirm with hostesses on the timing for that happy hour, it may be from only 5PM-630PM.   I ordered the Filet stuffed with Mushrooms and it was like butter. The mash potatoes and mac and cheese sides were worthy of licking off the plate. I certainly left feeling satisfied on a full belly of delicious dirty martinis (with blue cheese stuffed olives -- yum!) steak, and sides. Highly recommend for a fine dining experience!

I really want to give Sullivan's 4 stars but in comparing this experience to a recent visit to Longhorn, I just can't bring myself to do it.  Went here with a group from work for an "appreciation dinner"  Normally, Appreciation dinners end up at Chili's or Ruby Tuesday so I was completely shocked we ended up here.  Everything was great service wise.  Foodwise, it was good but I'd expect that from a place like this.  I ordered one of their Mixup lunches which gives you a salad option, a protein and a side.  I ordered the mixed green salad, the porcini mushroom and pepper encrusted strip and an order of carmelized cauliflower as a side.  The strip was amazing.  It came sliced over a layer of steak sauce.  It was cooked perfectly.  The salad was ok....mixed greens with tomatoes, blue cheese and a dressing that I still do not recognize.  The cauliflower came in a mound.  Honestly, this had to be 1/2 to 2/3 of the head of cauliflower.  It was seasoned with capers and other herbs.  While the taste was good, the quantity was entirely too much and I could only eat half.  The decor of the place is as you would expect with a lot of medium to dark wood but it just didn't do anything for me.  Same with the service. While they were all friendly, our water just didn't go beyond what he was expect to do.     Sorry, Sullivans but I can get better service at Longhorn and frankly I think their food is better also.   But still this is a solid or 3 1/2 star review.

Was here for the recent #wwlp2014 and it's the first time I have been here.  The bar area is nice and gets fairly packed!  There are tables tucked around the corners, which give you some intimacy if you can snag one.  It's hard to order a drink if you aren't sitting directly at the bar.  They should have a server come around and take orders when there are a lot of people standing in the bar area.  (can you say lost revenue?)  The event was in a private room in the back, which has another patio-type room at the other end, so longer and narrow.  They packed in an amazing amount of pretty people, music and fun for the evening.  They were serving a Knockout Cocktail, which was pineapple and delicious.  Apps were a big hit... cheesesteak egg rolls (oh, so good), bruschetta and shrimp cocktail.    The staff were a bit overwhelmed by the crowd, but stayed very focused and handled everyone pleasantly.  I would say one minus is when you come blasting out of this high-energy event you are tromping right through the middle of the dining room... I felt bad for the diners who were startled by the sudden interruption of their quiet meals. oops.  Overall, with the staff and the quality of refreshments, I'd try Sullivan's again, but this time for dinner!
Love it here Thursday nights,  Live band,  nice atmosphere,  and the blueberry lemon drop Martini is the best.

I used to go to Sullivan's several years ago when Southend was just getting going. I wanted to take my son out for a special dinner last Friday to celebrate his new summer internship. Thought it would be good to try Sullivan's again as it is pretty close to my home in Dilworth. Made the reservation on-line which was by far the best part of the experience. It went downhill from there.  First, I was annoyed they called me to make sure I would honor my reservation. What am I supposed to do, drop everything and give them a call to let them know I would be there?  Second, the place smelled like a urinal cake.  I felt like I was dining in a porta-potty. Third, the hostess felt my son and I should dine in the back private room rather than the main dining room. We were dressed appropriately and the place was not crowded. We did complain and they moved us to the main dining room. Fourth, the staff rushed us through the meal and they were flat out rude. The food was okay, but not distinguishable from other top steak houses. Wine list was overpriced compared to Bonterra Wine Room for same bottle of red. For the price, folks are better off at The Capital Grill, Flemmings, Beef'n Bottle, Ruth's Chris, or The Palm depending on your location.

The food at Sullivan's is amazing and probably the only reason I have this place two stars instead of one. My family decided to have thanksgiving dinner here along with two family friends. We had a dinner reservation at 6:15. We arrived promptly at 6:10 and used to complimentary valet to park the car. We waited about 30 minutes to be sat. Once sat we waited another long while for a server to come by and take our drink order. Dakota, our server, brought our drinks back and then disappeared for a while until coming back to take our order. We ordered two of the thanksgiving specials which comes with salad, two sides, turkey and dessert; we also ordered the one pound lobster tail, two crab cake appetizers and the Rockefeller salmon. The salads came out and we still had not received any bread or the appetizers. I had to ask the server if the crab cake was still coming or not. The crab cake arrived shortly there after. After finishing our salads and appetizer we still had no bread. We had to ask another server for bread to the table. Our entrees arrived soon after we got bread and were amazing. Everything was delicious absolutely no complaints of the food. However during the entrees, Dakota never came with refills and never stopped to check on everything. We then move onto boxing some entrees and getting the dessert, we waited about 15 minutes with no waiter and by the time we got to place the dessert order they had run out of the dessert we wanted. I got up to speak with a manager about the poor service and how it was unacceptable and he told me he would touch our table and speak with us directly. So we took the desserts Togo and waited for the checks. We had told Dakota at the beginning of the night we had two checks and how to split everything. The manager has still not stopped by and we are handed one check. So I asked a separate mama her from before to split the check and reiterated how bad the service was. This manager also assured me he would stop by and he would also adjust the check. Another 10 or so minutes goes by before we receive or checks. The adjustment was he took of the appetizers. After paying the bill a manager had still not stopped by. So we asked another server to bring a manager over. Once the manager got to the table all he had to say for the experience was that he agreed. He understood. It's safe to say we will not be coming back to this restaurant.

Sullivan's is situated in the trendy South End location in Charlotte. They offer complimentary valet which is the best bet as parking can get tight.  I love the ambience and decor in the restaurant. Classical music played in the background that was nice to my ears as I felt like I was in another world.   Chris the waiter was great! He was very detailed, attentive and didn't miss a beat.   My meal consist of lobster bisque soup for my starter, salmon rockerfeller (bernaise sauce, crabmeat and bacon) for my entree and strawberry cheesecake for dessert. Ummm! The salmon was so flavorful, my taste buds were pleased! I had horseradish mash potatoes as my side and it was delicious. This is one of my top places to eat in Charlotte.

We have eaten here several times and this is easily one of favorite steakhouses! Top three! I have ordered something different each time and cannot complain about anything. The martinis are great and the wine lost extensive.  If you haven't been, you are missing out! Go ASAP.

Great experience; 2nd time is always the best. Start with the crab cake, it's fantastic. If you're not feeling a cut of meat, go with the seared scallops and as a side, I highly recommend the Mac and cheese. Very awesome, almost like it is made with cream cheese! Great wine selection, get a bottle for sure. Dessert, cookies and cream pie. I went on a date night and we got out of there for $185. Pretty reasonable considering other similar joints in Charlotte can run you $220 easy. Another bonus is valet is friendly and accommodating. Highly suggested my friends!

Came here for restaurant week and it was really nice! We all ordered steak or salmon and it was delicious, wait staff was amazing and thought to our friends parents anniversary. Can't wait to be back.

My review is only for the bar area. We did not eat in the restaurant.  Went here to listen to the jazz quartet and have dessert after a day out.  Dessert (I had the cheesecake, my companion had the chocolate cake with vanilla ice cream) was really good.  We had coffee and water to wash our sweets down.  Our waitresses (we somehow ended up with two) were great. They both checked on us often enough and kept our drinks refilled as necessary.  We wanted to sit where we could see AND hear the musicians so we sat near the bar at a tall table, close to the patio area.  Great seats except that a slight smell of smoke wafted in continuously during our visit.   The quartet was fantastic. Great classic jazz, uptempo as well as laid back sounds.   I think they're in the wrong time slot as well as a bad location in the venue. They are set up in a back corner area of the bar area, where I assume seating was removed. It does appear the only location for them to set up comfortably.  However, because there are tv's in the bar and most of the seating in the area has patrons' backs toward the musicians, it doesn't seem likely that the quartet is getting enough visual or audio notice from the crowd.  The majority of the folk I observed in the time we were there (until 10 p.m., the same time the live music ends), seemed to be mid-30s. The folk who might enjoy the music seemed to gravitate toward the bar area around the time the group was packing up to leave.  Shame.  As a previous reviewer noted, the attire of the ladies working at the location is a bit short and tight (and the fishnets give them an air of "Las Vegas showgirl", in my mind) but it all fits the pseudo-upscale vibe I got from the place overall.  I don't usually frequent the south end area but if I'm in the area on a night the musicians are there, I'll drop in for dessert again.

After many delicious meals at Sullivan's sister restaurant Del Frisco's we were super excited to kick off restaurant week to compare the two. Sadly the experience at Sullivans was below expectations the entire night.   We showed up on time for a 7:00pm reservation and were told they overbooked and we would have to wait. We headed to the bar where I had to flag someone down for a wine list. When our table was ready (not a huge wait thankfully) we were escorted to our small table packed in the middle of two rows of booths. Being able to hear conversations quite clearly all around us did not provide the atmosphere of "nice steak dinner".   The Caesar salad that we both got was large, and had too much dressing for my taste, and the croutons were chewy like they weren't cooked long enough. My filet medallions were cooked as ordered but the steak lacked anything to recommend it. The horseradish potatoes had a very strong flavor that overpowered the steak. The end of the meal was the best part - my chocolate mousse was delicious but the boyfriend said his cheesecake was lackluster.    Even with the special restaurant week pricing the meal wasn't well priced enough for the quality of food we ordered. The restaurant was dimly lit and felt completely packed. I know that restaurant week, especially on the weekend, is a busy time for a restaurant but if the food and atmosphere are so uninspiring on a discount why would anyone return to pay full price?

My birthday dinner was there and it had been a while since I'd been there. My steak was good however my potato needed help. Overall the dinner was delicious and I really enjoyed my pinapple Martini it was so smooth and delicious as I remembered. It was late and I had no desert but next time I will. My honey had a cowboy style steak and he enjoyed it too.

First, I'll start with the good.  The three cheese Mac was really tasty.  My Bells Two Hearted ale was awesome.  Okay, I'm done with the good.  The service was some of the worst I've ever had.  I can't blame the waiter 100 percent. He looked like he was working hard,  but when you place a drink or food order, you don't go to other tables and take orders before you put ours in.  We waited long lengths of time for almost everything.  We were a party of 8, so you expect it to take longer with larger parties, but we were there almost 3 hours.  They seemed very under staffed.  Finally got our dinner and two of the orders were wrong.  Everyone was done eating by the time their food finally came. No manager ever came to the table to apologize and nothing was offered for the major inconvenience.  I'm sorry, any reputable establishment would have comp'd the meal, or offered something.  I don't even think I've ever been to a restaurant where a manager doesn't come and and ask how your dining experience was going.  Apparently, that isn't important at Sullivan's.  Never even saw a manager to talk to.  The food overall was only mediocre, so you can't even say it was worth it, because of the cheaper  pricing of restaurant week.  I can tolerate mediocre food but not poor management.  Needless to say, there are so many good places to eat in Charlotte, there is no reason to ever come back here.

As a self-proclaimed foodie I naturally get very excited when Queens Feast arrives a couple times a year. I am one of those people who peruse the menu before the week even begins and plan out exactly where I am going several days in advance. Considering many of my friends are of the vegetarian variety I was really craving a long-overdue steak.   Sullivan's was convenient for its South end location, and we were able to get a nice reservation time to fit our schedule. I was impressed with the ambiance overall. It was cozy, very classy, and interesting. Photos of boxers align the walls and a large wine vault (mmm wine) displays their vast collection.   We were greeted right away by very friendly staff. The Malbec I ordered was delicious - but I could see the wine list being slightly intimidating for new wine drinkers as it looked more like a novel than a list. We then received our bread which was very difficult to cut (we even heard the couple next to us say the same thing) and overly flaky but overall it tasted fresh.   We decided to order the $30 Restaurant Week Menu but they had similar Summer of $69 (for two) menu that seemed to be a great deal as well. I started with just a classic Caesar salad (I have a thing for them) which tasted good but definitely wasn't anything super amazing. Next, I had the Filet with Horseradish Mashed Potatoes and Green Beans. The steak and beans were cooked wonderfully but I felt the potatoes could have used a little bit more of the Horseradish flavor. Overall the dish was excellent and definitely satisfied my hunger for a steak! Finally my date and I shared our two desserts Banana Foster Bread Pudding (WOW!) and the Chocolate Mousse. Both were very good but the Bread Pudding was a stand-out.   I want to try some other steakhouses in the area since Charlotte has a plethora of them but I would definitely recommend Sullivan's - it was very good!

With a guest in town, headed to Sullivan's for a great steak in walking distance. Mid-week early dinner, so no concerns with a reservation. The bar looked nice and the decor in the rest of the restaurant is nice too. We both opted for the prix fixe menu, for me it was perfect since the filet is 6oz on that menu. My salad, filet, potatoes were great. My guest had a solid steak and bisque but potatoes were lacking compared to mine. Desserts were okay but nothing special...but neither of us are huge dessert fans. Overall for the price point this met my expectations with a really good steak and evening. Service was also good, wine was good and served properly, too. Will be trying the bar menu the next time I'm here. Probably not the best steakhouse I've been to in my entire life, but a solid option in South End for guests or a nice night out.

DO NOT EVER GO TO THEIR THURSDAY HAPPY HOUR IT SUCKS (PERIOD)...actually let me elaborate; the service is miserable and I wasn't ordering from their cheapo menu, bought a $50 app and had to grab my own FN silverware...this place is going downhill fast.  sucks i used to love sullivans but am having doubts about ever going back

I personally don't think you can find better steak in Charlotte.    I've been to Capital Grill and found it overrated.  For great true quality, I always go to Sullivan's.  They have the best Ahi Seared Tuna, Blue Cheese Wedge, Steaks and some phenomenal desserts.  We tend to get the Filets but sometime is go for the Cowboy Bone-In Ribeye.  I highly recommend the Gorgonzola Butter on top of either!  Sometimes they put too much but it's an easy topping to rake off if you prefer small amounts.  Also, the sides... I had the Cream Corn this weekend for the first time and it was crazy good.  I love the Baked Potato with some fresh chopped bacon.  You get so used to the basics with that side... but to have it done right really makes you realize what you have missed in it.  It's fantastic.  Sometimes we can get the Souffle but often get the Brownie.  It's 'souffle like' with it's baking dish and is always moist.  Just remember to save some of that red wine to have with this dessert!    To those who left 1 Star : I challenge you to actually go and experience Sullivan's for what they are known for.  It's hard to go in and judge a restaurant based on their lowest priced menu and trying to get out on $20.  Experience it for what they specialize in.  A bar menu is meant to be that... it's a bar menu.

I decided for queens feast 2013 my friends an I would try Sullivan's .  I was blown away with the food an service .  First I started with the shrimp an lobster bisque soup lots of shrimp n lobster no holding back it was a creamy flavor that made me wanna pick the bowl up n lick it lol I ordered the 10 oz NY strip w mashed potatoes w/ broccoli an I ordered the Cabernet goat cheese butter an they gave you 2 jumbo grilled shrimp wow The steak was amazing flavor from the grill to a great cut of steak but the Cabernet goat cheese butter just melted so beautifully on top of my steak mmmm I was dragging my shrimp through the butter . As if I had any room left but than I went for desert lol I ordered the bananas foster bread pudding w ice cream oh my goodness it was so good and I'm not a bread pudding fan lol. The bread pudding was served warm n lots of bananas on it an the edges were good an crispy which I loved .  I will for sure be visiting Sullivan's again an all my friends enjoyed their meal the chicken picatta with capers amazing . If you get a chance go to Sullivan's an the staff were polite an didn't rush us.

Made reservation for 9:30, was sat at 10:12. Not sure what point our reservation served. As a frequent and loyal customer of Sullivan's, I've never experienced such a long wait time with a reservation. We were told numerous of times that our table was being cleaned off only to witness people come in after us to be seated before us. This did not leave a great taste in my mouth at all. It'll be a long time before I step foot back into this establishment. Our waiter was not attentive, he took our order and then brought our salad. The next we saw him was when we finished our meal. We had to look for him in order to ask for the check. This was definitely not the service that I am used to receiving. This delayed our entire evening and we were late to our next event.

Food was terribly salty, salads were inedible, poor service, average appetizers, disappointing wine by the glass selection, the steak was good, aside from the salt in the sauce, and it was cooked well. All in all, they are very proud of a mediocre experience. For the money, I will not return.

Sullivan's I like you. I think we'll always be friends with benefits and maybe even date, but I don't want to marry you and commit to you and only you for the rest of my life. There are just other steakhouses that mean a whole lot to me. I hope you understand.  Sullivan's is like a good friend to me - consistent, present and convenient. The steak and sides have always been solid and the patio is perfection on a warm spring evening. The staff is typically friendly and efficient - even when things get pretty hairy on a Thursday or Sunday evening when the major specials are available. Which leads me to those specials...as Todd W mentioned - Thursday offers $5 Knockout martinis and bar bites while Sunday typically offers a $30 per person three course meal. The Knockout martini is my jam, friends. This pineapple-y, vodka with a touch of orange concoction is my personal nectar from the gods. Get one or four...and find a designated driver.   The dining room is much quieter so if you're looking for a romantic or focused business evening, make a reservation. I fully appreciate Sullivan's consistency and the South End location doesn't disappoint. Thanks, friend.
Not a fan on the bar food. The oyster did not look good. The steakrolls were soaked in way to much sweet stuff. The place smelled like a cigar lounge.

It had been a few years since I had eaten at Sullivan's, but I recalled enjoying a great meal there for my former employer's Christmas party back in 2008.  With a $50 gift card in hand, we decided to head to Sullivan's to celebrate my husband's 30th birthday.  With expectations relatively high, I have to be honest and say that we were underwhelmed (and our pockets where overwhelmed, as the high prices did not reflect the quality of our experience).  We both ordered steak, which comes with a salad. We both opted for Caesar.  It was a very large portion, but lacking in flavor.  My filet was cooked properly, and the bourbon peppercorn sauce added a nice kick.  The porterhouse did not get such gleaming reviews.    The brussels sprouts were undercooked, but I have to say that the bacon pieces were delicious. The mushrooms were good, but I agree with another reviewer who said they were quite salty. And I am that person putting salt on everything, so that says something. We ordered a half bottle of Cote du Rhone, which was probably the highlight of the meal.  We opted out of dessert.  The service started out strong, but started to dwindle by the end. I just expect more of a high-end experience when you are dishing out $200 for dinner with no appetizer and no dessert.

Very mediocre at best. The waitress Tara was horrible. Very inconsistent throughout the whole entire dining experience. The wait time for food was extremely long but never once did she ensure us that the food was coming and checked on the table. Once we voiced our concerns she became a little apologetic by telling us she was trying to find a table that skipped their bill and how she had a $200 tab with this table. Clearly she was more concerned about that scenario than getting her manager involved and taking care of the table right in front of her helplessly looking for their waitress. On top of her horrible service, a service assistant told us to ease up on her because she is only here for 2 weeks because of a situation with her daughter. On top of that we never did anything to this poor woman other than inquiry about our dinner service, only one round of drinks orders because she wasn't present. Also no manager ever touched our table he walked passed several times never inquired about our dining experience. We were celebrating a birthday instead it was overshadowed by tara family issues and other things.

Came here on Thursday for a few glasses of wine and apps for the first time. They were quick at moving people in and valeting their cars. Once inside they gave the gentleman I was with his beer Ina plastic glass because they were running a special, we immediately returned it and asked for a glass. The cheeseburger rolls melt in your mouth, they were delicious! We also had shrimp cocktail and crab cake, which were great. At the end of the afternoon the valet got my car in a matter of minutes. Very impressed and I will return.

Went this past Friday during Queens Feast and it was amazing. My gorgeous date and I made reservations for 8.30 but had to push them back 15 mins. When we got there valet was prompt as we walked to the front desk they said the wait will be shortly. We grabbed cocktails at the bar, which they were excellent "pours", we then waited a little longer. The staff and the managers kept updating us on the wait. They finally had out table ready after 20 mins. They sat us down and the manger told our waiter "Bob"(who is awesome btw) to get us a appetizer on the house for waiting so long. The food was amazing, the service was excellent. I totally recommend Sullivan's as the perfect date night spot.

We went to Sullivans about a year ago on Mothers day.   The service was prompt and the food was great.  Sullivans has become my favorite steak restaurant in charlotte.    They have the best Fillet I have ever had in any steak house.  I have also heard people rave about their fried lobster.  I will definitly go back and I heard it is Restaurant week prices every Sunday.

My husband and I went here for dinner and had a great experience!  The food was wonderful, each course was excellent.  We really enjoyed the crab cake appetizer, steaks and the banana's foster bread pudding.  I highly suggest the Knock Out cocktail, it's perfect for this time of year.  Our server Jude was both professional and friendly.  Service was excellent.  What stood out even more about this restaurant though was seeing how everyone else was enjoying their experience!  I was sitting in the corner of the restaurant and had a great view of the dining room.  It was great to see people having fun conversations with the wait staff and enjoying themselves.  I feel like you don't see that too often.  You can tell that the staff at Sullivan's really cares about their patrons and in my book, that makes a restaurant memorable.

Yesterday my husband and I went to Sullivan's to celebrate my birthday. He decided to take me there to try someplace we haven't been. We are regular "steakhouse " eaters at various known venues. What I noticed immediately is that the ambiance was wonderful and clearly it is a well visited place by many. I liked that we were seated in the back, a very private area where you could have a conversation. The service was impeccable and it was clear our waiter knew what he was talking about regarding wine pairing and preparation of a steak. My issue was the food. I was truly disappointed on many levels.  We moved to Charlotte from PA and we've noticed it is very difficult to get a Pittsburgh style medium rare steak. My husband had to send his steak back for another try. All of my food was way too salty. Whom ever ran the kitchen this evening was heavy handed with the salt to the point that I did not enjoy my dinner. My shrimp/lobster bisque, too much salt. The shaved Brussel sprouts. Too salty, The Chil encrusted rib eye, way too salty. What I enjoyed about my dinner were the mushrooms, just right and the Sullivan's reserve Cabernet.  Oh the key lime pie was tastey. The over abundance of salt not only took away the natural flavors of the food( that you missed) but would give a healthy person high blood pressure. One of the evening managers did come to the table and was sincere in his disappointment. We most likely because of this experience will not return to Sullivan's because there are other steakhouses that have consistent outcomes.
The steak here was very juicy and delicious.  The atmosphere was classy and the service was very good.  I have enjoyed everything from the steaks to the sides here.  Would like to come back soon!

Visited during restaurant week, (on a Sunday) and was happy with quality and quantity of food, special thanks to the $30 prix fixe menu. The service was top notch, as was the atmosphere. Two minor flaws kept me from giving a 5 star rating: Too much peppery seasoning on the NY Strip, which was of excellent quality and could have stood on its own - and the failure of the bartender to mention the $5 martini specials when as asked about them. (We found out during our meal from our waiter) All things considered, a great experience, and we will be back!

It's been a couple years since our last visit. Not as good as we remembered. Service was fine - think our server was fairly new. No offer to decant a 2008 Insignia.  Steaks were great but you had to get an 8 oz filet - nothing smaller The shaved Brussel sprouts were really good.  We sent the au gratin potatoes back as they were cold. The replacements were fine and tasty The ambiance was noisy.  They charged a corkage of $25. Most high end steakhouses only charge if it's on their menu. We weren't even offered or provided a wine menu. Overall we prefer Ruth's Chris uptown as the service is much more attentive and the environment is not as noisy.

This 4 star rating is based on service. A friend asked me out to dinner here and I already knew I wanted scallops tonight before I looked at the menu. If they had scallops, it was predetermined that's what I would be ordering. So they come out after about 25 minutes. Four bacon wrapped scallops. However, they were covered in a peach BBQ glaze What an awful idea. Scallops are one of those foods that needs a sprinkle of salt and to be served with a half of a lemon. God makes them naturally flavorful. Anything heavy will overwhelm that flavor, which was the case here. So I forced myself to eat these candied scallops. I have no one to blame, but myself, for not reading the menu in detail and ordering seafood at a steakhouse. It simply isn't a smart move. So I'm not going to dock them for having a menu item that seems like a bad idea. The Roasted Corn-Jicama Slaw was unique and tasty. Service was fine. Having been to Sullivan's several times before, I can say there is always great service and a good atmosphere, especially in the bar area where some days there's live music. The dining area is a bit stuffy. Overall recommended.

This is a great all around place. I love the dining room because everything is delicious but my favorite is the bar.  I like to go there since they have a great Happy Hour menu between 5-7 nightly and all night on Thursday. The menu includes sliced steak, salmon and a killer hamburger. The staff is always fantasic and friendly. I like to eat at the bar and on nights when it isn't too busy the bartender will keep me company. If you don't mind sweet girly drinks, you have to try The Knockout Martini. It's a fantastic blend of pineapple and vodka and 1 or 2 will do the trick. On Thursdays the Knockout Martinis and select red/white wine is $5. That's a great deal.  If you are looking for a good Sunday deal, eat in the bar from the Sunday Prime Time menu. You get a full meal with dessert for a reasonable price. During Queen's Feast Week they also do a great meal for $30 but that tends to get so packed you may have to wait for a later seating. I would recommend going earlier when the restaurant starts serving and eating in the bar. I've never had a problem getting dinner there on nights other than Thursday. Thursday is their specials night and tends to become more of a "Singles Bar" feel. Every night except Sunday there is live Jazz in the bar. I can't help but love this place!

I was taken here for lunch to celebrate professional administration day. We sat outside not realizing the black awning radiates heat.  Great for when it is cool, but a little too warm when it is 80 out.  The service was excellent. I had the seared ahi tuna and everyone else's food at our table looked amazing (Filet Mignon, Steakhouse Salad and Chicken Kale Salad).  I have a salt sensitivity so they worked with me with limited cajun spice and the sauce on the side.  We were all so very happy that we even got dessert.  Those desserts were to die for. The sales and event planner, Nichole Daniels, even came by our table to give us all a little gift for celebrating at Sullivan's.    I have only been here one other time and it was a little disappointing. I thought I would not come back, this visit has changed my mind and I am planning on bringing my husband for a date night soon.

We had a reservation and upon arrival we were told we would have to wait for a table to come available, after waiting 20 mins we decided to eat in the bar. Huge mistake.. Our waitress was very poor, we waited extended amounts of time for service and drinks. Her personality was great though, but personality does not get my drink. Ambiance? Yes there wasn't any, nor was there high end decor or finishes for the prices they charge for a meal. Laminated bar? Really? Also they dining/bar was very loud because of a large group of college boys ordering shots. Our food was cooked perfectly but management needs to work on everything else.. I would not reccomend.
Fabulous food. Fabulous service! Best steak in Charlotte. The Cowboy cut steak is to die for. Highly recommend.

In town for work and had the chance to catch it during restaurant week. Get the bay salmon and green beans. You won't be disappointed.  The mango sorbet was perfect, not fake mango flavored-had that real mango taste. Bar area was nice, bar hands are awesome. Had a few Moscow mules and enjoyed live entertainment on a Thursday night. Go, you won't regret it.

Absolutely great place for a date. Although its kind of land locked, parking is not a problem, the valet service made us feel like someone important.  The ambiance was great, it was packed for Valentines day so we took a high top table in the bar. They had a jazz band (if you want to call it that, a piano player and bass guitarist) I had the filet and my date had a ribeye. Both were seasoned and cooked perfectly. Big helping for side items. Desserts are standard fare but very well done. One of the best meals I've had in a while. Highly recommend this spot!

I have been wanting to go to Sullivan's for some time and I finally got to go for restaurant week this week. I would go even if it wasn't, but it is a really good deal to get a three course meal for $35 . First I must say the ambiance was very nice there and it set the mood for a nice romantic dinner.   I highly suggest this place for a nice date, special occasion , or if you want a really good dinner. The service was the best part about this place. I felt as if the staff was going to get it wrong when we first came through the door because it was a bit chaotic.  Nevertheless, to my surprise they were on top of it.   We were asked how everything turned out and honestly I ordered a medium rare NY strip steak and got a medium steak. They mixed up our orders. I was beyond hungry at that time to wait for another steak so I ate it . It was delicious but hard not to compare to the quality of other steakhouses in the area. She got the filet mignon and that tasted better than my NY strip . Not to exclude the fact that she got the medium rare too.    Other than the mix up the place was great! The service, atmosphere, and food are all top notch.   I wish I could give this place five stars, like other restaurants on AP's famous must eat restaurants if you are in Charlotte (2018 version coming soon), but not just yet. Stay tuned!
Sullivan's by far is our favorite restaurant in Charlotte! The best service staff around. Food is exceptional. Best creme brûlée in Charlotte!!

Called last night after receiving terrible service at another restaurant. Needed a table for 17. They have us a private room with 2 servers!! Service was superb and good was amazing!! Made our holiday outing incredible!

Had a limited availability item, a Wagyu cut. Perfection in any sense. Service was excellent. Sides of garlic mashed, garlic Mac and cheese and creamed corn where great. Topped it off with a Jack Daniels Single Barrel.

Went for a work event and was impressed witht he level of service and quality of food. I know with a large group (over 20) it can be hard on the server/kitchen but not here. All the food was fresh, delishious and came out at perfect temps. I had the roasted chicken which was very tender/moist and well seasoned with the mashed potatoes, equally as good and green beans. I would go back and eat again on my own based on this experience with the large group.

Our Anniversary Dinner was lovely and the staff was friendly. They took our picture, framed it with a Sullivan's photo holder and they all signed it.  Our server was nice but distracted and not attentive: forgot plate request for bread and drink refill request and us for most of the time.   Thankfully Susan was there with her lovely butterfly necklace and smile to bring the plate, refill the drink, take the plates, and bring the desert.  Thank all for lovely visit!

We've been to Sullivan's 5 times.   The first time was fantastic and full price. The second time was Restaurant week. The 3rd, 4th, and 5th was for their Sunday Prime Time special for various occasions.  First thing I have to say is AVOID RESTAURANT WEEK.  They're way over crowded, the menu is limited, and you're going to wait.  Second thing... DEFINITELY hit their Sunday Prime Time Special.  For $32, you get twice the selection as restaurant week, and the food is prepared fresh.  Third... get the Bananas Foster Bread Pudding for dessert.  It's awesome.    Fourth... highly recommend Renee as a server.  She was attentive, friendly, helpful, and on top of things.    So in conclusion... 5 stars for Renee, the Sunday Prime Time Special & the bread pudding.  2 stars for restaurant week (and take any reviews written during restaurant week with a grain of salt).

A vegetarian in a steak house!  Yes, it can happen.  My omnivore husband ordered their three course special:  calamari, the wedge salad, and beef medallions, which came with two shrimp and mashed potatoes. I chose the wedge salad, which, happily, did not come with bacon, horseradish mashed potatoes and creamed spinach.  First, we were greeted with a hunk of bread that could have lasted us for a week.  I ate the jalapeño slices from my husband's calamari, which were simultaneously hot and sweet.  The blue cheese dressing on the wedge was a tad sweet for my taste, but topped with yummy blue cheese and fresh tomatoes.  The freshly ground pepper cut the sweetness of the dressing.  I could taste the nutmeg in the spinach, which was topped with a scattering of Parmesan.  The mashed potatoes were creamy, and I could taste the horseradish.  Although I could sense the apprehension our waiter felt when he realized that he was dealing with a vegetarian, he recovered from his surprise quickly and delivered impeccable service.
Seated on time, no delay with reservation. Food very good food and service. Well worth the money. Parking is tough have to use complimentary valet.
Yum!!!! We had a HUGE party last night/ 30 people.  Service was great.  The crab legs were so big and meaty!!! Filet was amazing and the side dishes were huge!

I took 3 of my coworkers here for dinner.  It was simply excellent and the service exceeded expectations.  No stuffy wait staff either.  The hostesses could act a little more interested.  Everything we had was excellent...  Shrimp Cocktail - excellent, huge, cocktail sauce so delish.  Caesar Salad - fresh, crisp, very tasty dressing but not overpowering.  Bread - warm, fresh, had to fight over last piece  Wine - excellent selection. I am not a connoisseur by any stretch but its a great offering.  Steak - of course, the steak... cooked to perfection and oh so amazing.  I ordered the filet.  Wow!  I skipped dessert.  Who has room after all the other stuff!  I did have a coffee.  It was well brewed, served hot.  About a week after my visit, I received a thank you card in the mail from our server and she remembered a couple of things about our conversation - like my recent visit to Switzerland.  A few days after that, I got a thank you card from one of the managers.  What a nice touch.

Dress nice when you come for dinner there is a bar area in case you feel a little under dressed. The steak is amazing here and I always choose to add the goat cheese butter to the top of my medium Rare steak because I feel like it was sent from heaven! The Oysters Rockefeller is good but one serving is never enough for me. The wine menu is extensive and in my opinion I don't like the pineapple martinis (never have) but the bartender here knows how to make an awesome mojito which in this town seems difficult.

Last night I went with a group of friends to Sullivan's Steakhouse for a birthday dinner. It's definitely a nice place to go to have dinner. The food was ok, I just think it's not worth the price. The Caesar salad is just a big piece of lettuce with Cesar dressing which kind of disappointed me. I ordered the salmon which was good but small, with the asparagus which was not seasoned. Now I will say that the cheesecake is amazing. Another thing was we ordered champagne and the glasses were dirty. The waitress had to go back three or four times to get clean ones. She was a nice lady, she even saved us some money by showing us a deal. After we was done eating we were ready to pay, the waitress took almost 45min to bring us our ticket and even longer to check us out. Other than that it's a nice restaurant, just over priced.

My wife and I went it Sullivan's Steakhouse last Thursday it was my first time since being in Charlotte I was pleasantly surprised. The service was great as well as the food. We really enjoyed the experience.

Jan 1 2017 after dinner at another near by steakhouse my girlfriend and I decided to check out the bar at Sullivan's before headed home . I was desperately dying for this dessert that another sister restaurant had but was closed so to my surprise Sullivan's had a better version !!!  Yay me ! I love the bar there !  It's so beautiful and it's always interesting conversations going on ( I like to ease drop ) . The bartender is Amazing  !!!!!!!' I prob couldn't have asked for a better bartender!
